title: Assistant Manager
description:
**ASSISTANT STORE MANAGER**

**BALDWIN, NY**

**Company description**

Ready Coffee is a privately-owned, rapidly growing retail coffee company based in the Hudson Valley of New York. We are driven by our mission to bring best-quality craft coffee to on-the-go consumers in a fun and inviting way.

We are obsessed with making craft coffee into a fast and enjoyable everyday experience. Our drinks are handmade using the highest quality ingredients by a crew of impeccably trained baristas. We serve our customers using personalized attention and special touches to foster lasting relationships. Only through our dedication to innovation and continuous improvement have we been able to combine best-in-class speed with best-in-class quality and service. All our coffee is produced at our craft roasting facility in the Hudson Valley.

Ready Coffee’s inclusive and empowering culture is guided by core values and principles that inform our daily work. We build strong teams and give our people the best tools available to help them succeed in their jobs.

Ready Coffee is in the early stage of expanding its store base. This expansion is currently centered in New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut.

**Job description**

We are seeking a hardworking, organized and leadership-minded Assistant Manager. This position will report to the Store Manager.

A Ready Coffee Assistant Store Manager is the key aid to the Store Manager, with a particular focus on team development and operations support. The Assistant Manager desires to build their leadership skills and learn to manage a successful team. The Assistant Store Manager is eager to learn, builds great relationships with team members and customers, and embodies the Ready Coffee Core Values. Applicants should aspire to become a Store Manager.

**Responsibilities**

· Lead and inspire the team during shifts.

· Assist in training and coaching new team members.

· Introduce and reinforce standards, new procedures, and seasonal changes.

· Improve team member performance through feedback, coaching, and encouragement.

· Brief the store manager on team member performance and key store operational metrics.

· Review daily sales data and reconcile discrepancies in the absence of the store manager.

· Make daily bank deposits and manage change reserves.

· Assist in managing store inventory.

**Location**

Poughkeepsie, New York

(All work to be done at Company work location)

**Job Type**

Full-time, 30+ hours per week

**Pay & benefits**

Up to $27.50 per hour; number includes average tips of $10 per hour. Actual tips will vary based on a variety of factors including location, hours, and quality of service.

Other benefits

· Flexible schedule

· Paid time off

· Paid training, career development, and personal development

· Career advancement opportunities

· Free coffee and other discounts

**Qualifications**

· High School Diploma/GED required

· Minimum one year leadership experience preferred

· Night and weekend availability

· Reputation as a positive role model

· Eager to learn, grow and adapt

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills

· Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite

· Ability to direct the work of others

· Exhibit a passion for Ready Coffee’s values and culture

**Other**

Ready Coffee is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Theater Actor
description:
***\\*\\* AUDITION IN-PERSON (ONLY) IN NEW YORK CITY ON SEPTEMBER 29th! \\*\\****

**What is American Immersion Theater?**

Best-known through its performances as The Murder Mystery Co., American Immersion Theater is a national company that puts actors in a variety of incredibly interactive performances. In this digital age, we have too many people watching entertainment through screens. When they do go to see a show, they sit and watch it in silence. Here at American Immersion Theater, we want to break that fourth wall and give people a chance to be a part of the story. With your help, we get to do just that. We provide people an escape from the everyday and help them to believe. Our mission statement is as true as it is simple - American Immersion Theater is a story about you.

**Advantages of Acting with American Immersion Theater**

American Immersion Theater is the largest dinner theatre company in the U.S., performing over 7,000 shows for nearly 800,000 guests, in approximately 40 locations across the United States. Having performed at countless celebrity galas and 400 of the Fortune 500 companies, American Immersion Theater is growing strong!

As a member of our team what you do really matters, and your work has a direct effect on the success of the whole company. We have a lot to offer, including:

* Unparalleled improv training that will help bring out your best, as well as the best in others
* Flexibility that allows you to choose gigs based on your schedule
* A fast-paced growth environment

title: Assistant Director, Training & Development, HR Administration/Woodhull
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals:**

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description**

To provide mandatory training for all staff, NYU affiliates, contractors, volunteers/Interns. To ensure staff receives workplace skills that they can utilize on the job. organizing training materials and overseeing training programs, as well as ensuring that the costs of planned programs don’t exceed the provided budget. You will also monitor and evaluate the progress of trainees, work with department managers to assess training and development needs, and provide senior management with trainees’ program reports.

**Areas of Responsibilities:**

* Training
* New Employee Orientation and Systemwide New Employee Orientation
* Support training for Computer classes, CPR certifications, Central Office seminars

**Summary of Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Identify training and development needs of all the departments.
* Work with department managers to develop training programs and ensure they deliver results.
* Organize training materials and assist with training programs
* Designs, develops and delivers training courses and programs to meet identified needs for personnel at all levels of the organization.
* Evaluates the success of training programs in the management and development continuum and redesigns programs based on these evaluations.
* Assist with conducting research to determine management and employee training needs.
* Answer employee questions and inquiries related to training and development programs and resolve any training-related issues when they arise
* Attends seminars and conferences to maintain presence in the training professional’s network.
* Collaborates with key personnel within the organization to ensure training needs are addressed and assist with Training-on-the Go.
* Keeps abreast of training and development activities, i.e. concepts, theory, techniques and approaches to training.
* Back up for all in-house trainings along with New Employee Orientation, System-wide NEO, CPR classes- includes room allocation, registration, confirmation notices, attendance sheets, setting up training rooms and ordering and gathering training materials/packets.
* Create and maintain training calendar.
* Input data entry and create training activities in PeopleSoft ELM.
* Performs other related duties as needed assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

1. A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university in Education, Public Health, Psychology, Personnel Administration, Management, Public Administration or related approved discipline; and,  
2. Six years of progressively responsible experience in planning and manpower development and training programs, medical or public health administration or other fields related to training, development and manpower analysis, of which at least two years shall have been in a supervisory, managerial or administrative capacity related to the organization, formulation, development and implementation of such plans and programs; or,  
3. A Master's Degree from an accredited college or university in Education, Management, Social Work, Medical Administration, Psychology, Personnel Administration, Public Administration or a related approved field with five years of experience as described in (2) and two years in a supervisory, managerial or administrative capacity;  
4. Extensive knowledge of the principles of training and manpower development programs and the ability to analyze and determine the needs of the Corporation, Network or facility; or,  
5. A satisfactory combination of training, education and experience indicating the ability to perform satisfactorily.

Department Preferences

* Masters Degree
* Data entry in PeopleSoft and GPS

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $68,940.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Account Director
description:
**Company Description**  

Bartle Bogle Hegarty (BBH) is a world-famous creative agency that makes jaw-dropping, thumb-stopping, eye-opening work for brands across the globe. Founded in London in 1982, we now have offices in New York, Los Angeles, Stockholm, Mumbai, Singapore and Shanghai. Our first ad for Levi's showed a black sheep traveling in the opposite direction to a flock of white ones. That's where we got our logo and our guiding philosophy: when the world zigs, zag. Why? Because it's easy to zig, to go with the grain. It feels safe. It feels like the sensible thing to do. But the greater risk is failing to stand out. We believe in the power of difference to make a difference.


Our goal is a simple one: make the best work in the world. That's where you come in. We need rebels, dreamers, thinkers, mathematicians, makers, artists, visionaries, observers, the different and the unreasonable. We need Black Sheep. People who want to make the hearts flutter and minds do flips, who can change businesses and culture. People who want to make a difference, come here for something different.


https://www.bartleboglehegarty.com

**Our Talent Philosophy:**


In hiring, BBH looks for two characteristics: being good, and being nice. Being only one of these is not in our DNA.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for a full-time **Account Director** for a multinational major appliance and consumer electronics corporation to join our team.


The ideal account person will be a leader, business oriented, have proactive curiosity, and cool-headedness, behave like the CEO of their account, brand or project. You will be the only person in the agency who touches every aspect of a project in some way: from the relationship with the client, to the relationship with the team, from strategy to finance to creative to production. It is the role of an account person at any level to ensure that a project meets the client and agency's goals to produce great, creative work, on time and on budget, and to motivate the team along the way.

**Responsibilities:**


The account director is the agency's leader, producing and environment for the creative work to excel. You will nurture junior team members and client relationships. The account director will:

* Partner with the clients, using the knowledge of the clients' business to create the best conditions for the right work to grow, leading to the success of both our partners and our agency.
* Manage our teams (direct reports, colleagues, and seniors) with dignity, building followership across the board, navigating the BBH process effortlessly and can lean on the internal expertise available (across offices) to provide outstanding creative solutions to a range of business problems.
* Be fluent in all phases of the creative process from strategy, through creative to production and bring their expertise to each stage, foreseeing issues before they arise and heading them off. Taking pressure off the team by handling the difficult conversations and know when to escalate for support is also part of their role.
* Be keenly aware of the value BBH brings to the table, which allows the agency to price our skills well and talk about BBH value convincingly.
* Be motivated when searching for new business opportunities within the marketing community, always searching for growth while keeping their eyes out for client needs, and quickly translating these needs into a solution to grow the agency business.

  

**Qualifications**  

* 6+ years of relatable experience in client service
* Experience contributing to new business efforts and driving organic growth
* Ability to lead multiple teams and projects at once
* Understanding of business and marketing strategy
* Detailed and organized
* Passion for creativity


#LI-Onsite

 **Additional Information**  

Compensation Range: $91,000 - $154,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. We anticipate the application deadline for this job posting will be 11/04/2024.

title: Executive Assistant, Education
description:
About the Metropolitan Museum of Art
The Met presents over 5,000 years of art from around the world for everyone to experience and enjoy. The Museum lives in two iconic sites in New York City—The Met Fifth Avenue and The Met Cloisters. Millions of people also take part in The Met experience online.
Since its founding in 1870, The Met has always aspired to be more than a treasury of rare and beautiful objects. We are committed to fostering a collaborative and respectful work environment with a staff as diverse as the audiences we engage. Our staff members are art lovers who are passionate about working toward a common goal: creating the most dynamic and inspiring art museum in the world.
At The Met, every staff member – from security officers to researchers to scientists and beyond – lives by our core values of respect, inclusivity, collaboration, excellence, and integrity.
Respect: Engage one another with collegiality, empathy, and kindness, always.
Inclusivity: Ensure that all are and feel welcome and valued.
Collaboration: Reach across boundaries to exchange ideas and work together toward our shared mission.
Excellence: Lead the cultural world in quality and expertise—and inspire curiosity and creativity.
Integrity: Hold ourselves to the highest moral standards, admit when we fall short, and then evolve.
GENERAL STATEMENT OF RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:
As the Executive Assistant , you will provide administrative support to the Chair of Education. Utilizing high emotional intelligence and communication skills, you will develop constructive relationships with internal and external stakeholders including Trustees, donors, the Education Visiting Committee, external education communities and Museum staff. You will assist in coordinating education initiatives, events, communications and research. You will develop trust both within and outside of the department and act as a liaison between the Chair and internal and external stakeholders.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:* Strategic management, oversight and support of the Education Chair’s calendar, including assisting in the preparation and distribution of materials for internal and external parties
* Manage the logistical support for meetings, presentations, events and programing by developing agendas, coordinating presentation decks, and writing talking points to ensure smooth operation.
* Prepare meeting reports and record minutes for the Education Visiting Committee, Education Departmental meetings and other organized events.
* Under guidance and supervision of the Chair and Development liaisons, manage and support a relationship strategy for Education donors, committees and community partners.
* Coordinate logistical details for departmental newsletters, presentations, talks, meetings and social events.
* Under guidance and supervision of the Chair and Development liaisons, plan, produce and manage logistics for small and large scale events and other special projects as assigned.
* Prepare supporting materials for Chair in preparation of meetings and events.
* Coordinate all travel arrangements, prepare detailed travel itineraries, and oversee expense reports related to travel as well as other general expenses for reimbursement
* Serve as point of contact for staff and other individuals who wish to reach the Chair; respond to or reroute on behalf of the Chair, when appropriate
* Draft correspondence, handle mail, and screen phone calls; Maintain an organized filing system
* Draft Education Updates for the Management Team meetings and other notable meetings
* Assist with general office functions –phone support, escorting guests, office maintenance and ordering supplies, etc.
* Other related duties as assigned
* Evening and weekend hours as needed.


REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS:* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required
* 5 years of administrative office, business, or related experience
* Proven experience with a variety of administrative tasks including filing, answering phones, and managing an executive calendar.
* Experience planning, producing and managing logistics for events
* Experience in Arts Administration
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work well in a complex production oriented, deadline driven department
* Excellent organizational skills, detail oriented, and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
* Ability to proactively build strong relationships and trust with colleagues at all levels of management
* Must be able to interact and communicate effectively with all levels of staff as well as members of the Board of Trustees, VIPs, and other committees, visitors/associates
* Must be an analytical thinker and demonstrated problem solver
* Ability to anticipate needs in a thoughtful and strategic way
* Demonstrated successful project management/coordination experience
* Knowledge of software programs for managing projects, schedules, and budgets; strong quantitative skills
* Excellent written and oral communication skills required
* Ability to operate with discretion when working with confidential information and materials
* Thorough proficiency in Microsoft Word, Outlook, PowerPoint and Excel with willingness to learn new computer programs required
* Knowledge of New York philanthropic community desirable


COMPENSATION RANGE:* Pay Range: $42.00 - $44.00 / Hourly
* The advertised pay scale reflects the good faith minimum and maximum salary range for this role. The advertised pay scale is not a promise of a particular wage for any specific employee. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may be dependent on a variety of factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s experience, education, special licensing or qualifications, and other factors.


Location Requirements
At time of employment, employees are expected to be located within commuting distance of the Museum. “Commuting distance” means that they are located in one of following states: New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, or Pennsylvania (the “Tri-state and PA” areas), and be able to commute to and from the Museum in a single day.
Benefits Offerings
The Museum provides competitive compensation, and generous benefits and perks for all eligible employees. Note: Benefits Offering may differ based on Employee Status.* Medical, dental, vision and life insurance
* 403(b) basic retirement plan and optional matching retirement plan with an outstanding employer match
* Considerable paid time off, including annual leave, sick leave, and 13 Museum holidays
* Long-term disability coverage
* Flexible Spending Accounts & Health Savings Account (pre-tax income for eligible health care expenses)
* Commuter benefits (pre-tax income for parking or mass transit expenses)
* Free financial-planning services
* Financial assistance for relevant coursework, seminars, and training programs
* 25% discount for staff in Museum shops
* A subsidized staff cafeteria
* Access to the Museums Council pass, which grants free admission to various museums and cultural institutions


Research shows that women and people from underrepresented groups often apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. We recognize that it is highly unlikely that someone meets 100% of the qualifications for a role. If much of this job description describes you, then please apply for this role.
The Met is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, The Met will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed in this process, please contact benefits@metmuseum.org.
The Metropolitan Museum of Art provides equal opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, mental or physical disability, pregnancy, alienage or citizenship status, marital status or domestic partner status, genetic information, genetic predisposition or carrier status, gender identity, HIV status, military status and any other category protected by law in all employment decisions, including but not limited to recruitment, hiring, compensation, training and apprenticeship, promotion, upgrading, demotion, downgrading, transfer, lay-off and termination, and all other terms and conditions of employment.

title: PARENT ADVOCATE - Enhanced Family Foster Care (Hybrid)
company: Seamen's Society for Children and Families
description:
**Job Summary**:

Foster Care works in partnership with families to provide trauma-informed, culturally sensitive and inclusive services to promote permanency, safety, and well-being and reduce the length of stay in foster care. The Parent Advocate provides comprehensive support for parents on how to navigate the child welfare system with the goal of reunification. The Parent Advocate provides transparent services and ensures an equitable environment that supports birth parents' rights and goals toward reunification. The Parent Advocate will provide concrete support to parents as they engage with the agency to plan for their children in foster care. The Parent Advocate may participate in Family Team Conferences, Case Planning Meetings, Family Visits and/or accompany parents to appointments.

**Duties and Responsibilities**:

* Maintains a caseload of families with a goal of reunification
* Meet with parents at or near the time of Intake to Foster Care and act as a credible messenger for parents planning for their children
* Participate in case planning meetings or family team conferences to support parents, provide insight, clarification, and emotional regulation to parents to make meetings more effective and planning more successful.
* Meet with families during Family Time (Family Visiting) as a support to encourage visits and to help parent's problem solve obstacles to healthy, effective time with their children
* Accompany parents to service providers such as drug treatment, housing, mental health programs, or court as a source of encouragement and support and helping parents to overcome ambivalence about starting a new programming
* As a key member of the Case Planning Team coordinate activities to assist the family as they move towards achieving permanency
* Make monthly contacts with families on trial discharge
* Facilitate weekly parent support groups
* Performs other duties/responsibilities as assigned within the scope of the position

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

Seamen's Society is currently looking for talent of all cultures, religions, races, and gender expressions with the following qualifications:

* High School/GED required
* Bi-lingual Spanish preferred
* Computer literate, MS Office; NYS Connections knowledge preferred
* Candidates who have had biological children successfully reunited from foster care preferred and children must be home at least six months
* Must be able to travel within the NYC Metropolitan area.
* Must be able to participate in an on-call rotation
* Detailed-oriented; ability to function as a team player and possesses a demonstrated passion for advancing the work of serving children and families. Ability to work with diverse populations
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, flexibility, professionalism, time management and organizational skills.

**Additional Information**

Seamen's Society is committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all staff members, participants, volunteers, subcontractors, and vendors. We respect diversity and accordingly are an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate based on race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage, citizenship status, age, disability, sex, gender, gender identity, or expression (sexual orientation, marital status, partnership status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $21.98 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 35 per week

Benefits:

* 403(b) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Mileage reimbursement
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you able travel within the NYC Metropolitan area?
* Are you computer literate?
* Are you bi-lingual (English/Spanish)?
* Did you have/had biological children successfully reunited from foster care?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

License/Certification:

* driver's license (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Business Solutions/Technical Operations Internships - Media Tech Summer 2025
description:
**Company Description**  

See yourself at NBCU! Be a part of our intern community, a diverse group of curious and passionate trailblazers who we believe are the future of our industry.


The NBCUniversal Internship Program allows students to unlock their potential by contributing to big projects in meaningful ways that matter. To thrive as an NBCU intern, you are ready to bring your passion for media, entertainment, and technology along with your desire to learn each day.


In addition to all of our internships being paid, we will also offer the following for our Summer 2025 interns:

* Paid company holidays for full-time interns.
* Robust networking, learning and development opportunities.
* Complimentary Peacock subscription during your internship.
* Free admission to Universal Parks to use during your internship.
* Access to mental health resources including counseling sessions.
* Financial assistance to offset expenses for transportation and housing may be available on a needs-based basis for eligible in-person interns. More details about eligibility for this assistance will be provided at the time of offer.

  

At CNBC Headquarters in Englewood Cliffs, NJ, you’ll have access to great perks and amenities:


Sweat it out * - Free onsite fitness center with state-of-the-art equipment, basketball court and running course, plus daily group classes

Eat up * - Gourmet cafeteria with daily specials plus soup and salad bars

Unwind * - Massage therapy, ping pong tables, foosball

Extras * - Dry cleaning, shoe shining and sneak peeks


Don’t have a car? No problem! We offer free shuttle transportation to and from multiple locations in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Hoboken and Jersey City.

  

Summer 2025 Recruitment Timeline:

**September 16 – October 4:** Applications Open (may close early due to applicant volume)

**Mid-September – Late October:** First round video interviews

**Early to mid-November:** Second round interviews

**Late November:** Selected candidates receive offers

 **Job Description**  

Summer 2025 Internship Program:

* Applications Close: October 4th at 11:59pm ET. Pro Tip: Submit your application as soon as possible – applications could close earlier due to applicant volume!
* Program Dates: June 2 – August 8, 2025
* Time Commitment: 40 hours per week. Exact schedule to be determined based on business need.
* Format: Opportunities listed will require an intern to work from Englewood Cliffs, NJ.


To Apply:

* Submit a one-page resume that outlines your work experience, accomplishments, and your graduation month and year.
* Optional: submit a cover letter that highlights your passion for NBCUniversal, the locations (listed below) you are open to for internships, and your top areas of interest (opportunities listed below).

Upload a transcript (unofficial transcripts are fine) that confirms your status as an actively enrolled student in a degree-granting program.  
* 

Here at NBCU, we strive to be on the forefront of leading-edge technology and are seeking a savvy troop of technologists we call Media Tech Interns.


Our program exposes students to technical opportunities across NBCUniversal’s Operations & Technology organizations and serves as a main pipeline into our Rotational Associate Programs. As a NBCUniversal Media Tech Intern, you will gain hands-on experience, allowing you to apply your classroom knowledge to practical situations. We offer a 2 day in-person orientation in our NY office where we bring all interns together to meet each other and various business leaders.


Students will experience firsthand how one of the largest media and entertainment companies in the world operates and delivers strategic, innovative solutions.


Areas of placement may include, but are not limited to:  



* **Media Operations, Program Ops:** Our team is responsible for order management and file delivery across domestic broadcast, domestic VOD, international broadcast, international VOD, and studio fulfillment. There is always something exciting to do- we are always busy! We just wrapped up the Olympics, and we have new FAST channels coming up and have changes in our studio space soon coming. We work across a lot of different teams so there’s a lot of opportunity to learn and network, and our team can be described as "front of house" meaning we communicate all day, every day with our partners, productions and clients. At the end of the day, our responsibility is to get content out the door on time to wherever it needs to go, wherever that happens to be in the world. As the intern, you’ll get to partner with operators and supervisors to understand any pain points in our current workflows, track manual work that should better operationalized or automated, and will have the opportunity to track and work on big upcoming titles (helping to ensure delivery to partners!).

* **Strategic Program Management:** We are a core component of the company's data strategy, providing actionable insights to drive strategic business decisions. Our intern will receive hands on experience supporting the company's current JVs, along with our product fulfillment and engineering groups. The intern will support data analysis & visualization to inform decision-making, provide project support in various project phases, including discovery, product, and engineering handoffs and formal team read outs. The intern will also support process improvement and collaboration across the team.

 **Qualifications** **Basic Requirements:**

* Must be actively enrolled in a degree-granting program at an accredited institution during the entire duration of the program (June 2025 through August 2025). May 2025 graduates are not eligible for our Summer 2025 Internship Program.
* Current class standing of sophomore or above (30 credits).
* Must be presently authorized to work for any employer in the United States and must not require work visa sponsorship from NBCUniversal now or in the future to retain authorization to work in the United States.
* Must be willing to work in Englewood Cliffs, NJ.


For further clarification, candidates currently on any student or exchange visa (e.g. F-1 CPT, F-1 OPT, J-1, M-1) are not eligible to apply unless they will be able to change or adjust to another status that grants work authorization without NBCUniversal sponsorship.


NBCUniversal is an E-Verify company, requiring all employees to have an active Social Security number. Any candidate receiving an internship offer must complete I-9 form with Social Security number within 3 days of hire.

 **Desired Characteristics:**

* Students with class standing of junior or above preferred.
* Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above.
* Familiarity and/or desire to learn Microsoft products (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint).
* Proficiency in data tools and software such as Python and SQL.

  

The hourly rate for undergraduate student interns is $30.00


The hourly rate for graduate student interns is $30.00


The hourly rate for MBA student interns is $30.00

 **Additional Information**  

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision.


NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

title: Cyber Security Internships - Media Tech Summer 2025
description:
**Company Description**  

See yourself at NBCU! Be a part of our intern community, a diverse group of curious and passionate trailblazers who we believe are the future of our industry.


The NBCUniversal Internship Program allows students to unlock their potential by contributing to big projects in meaningful ways that matter. To thrive as an NBCU intern, you are ready to bring your passion for media, entertainment, and technology along with your desire to learn each day.


In addition to all of our internships being paid, we will also offer the following for our Summer 2025 interns:

* Paid company holidays for full-time interns.
* Robust networking, learning and development opportunities.

**September 16 – October 4:** Applications Open (may close early due to applicant volume)

**Mid-September – Late October:** First round video interviews

**Early to mid-November**: Second round interviews

 **Job Description**  

Summer 2025 Internship Program:

* Applications Close: October 4th at 11:59pm ET. Pro Tip: Submit your application as soon as possible – applications could close earlier due to applicant volume!
* Program Dates: June 2 – August 8, 2025
* Time Commitment: 40 hours per week. Exact schedule to be determined based on business need.
* Format: Opportunities listed will be fully virtual.


To Apply:

* Submit a one-page resume that outlines your work experience, accomplishments, and your graduation month and year.
* Optional: submit a cover letter that highlights your passion for NBCUniversal, the locations (listed below) you are open to for internships, and your top areas of interest (opportunities listed below).

Upload a transcript (unofficial transcripts are fine) that confirms your status as an actively enrolled student in a degree-granting program.  
* 

Here at NBCU, we strive to be on the forefront of leading-edge technology and are seeking a savvy troop of technologists we call Media Tech Interns.


Our program exposes students to technical opportunities across NBCUniversal’s Operations & Technology organizations and serves as a main pipeline into our Rotational Associate Programs. As a NBCUniversal Media Tech Intern, you will gain hands-on experience, allowing you to apply your classroom knowledge to practical situations. We offer a 2 day in-person orientation in our NY office where we bring all interns together to meet each other and various business leaders.


Students will experience firsthand how one of the largest media and entertainment companies in the world operates and delivers strategic, innovative solutions.


Areas of placement may include, but are not limited to:  



* **Cyber Security Defense Ops – Threat 2:** The Cyber Support Operations (CSO) Team is a division of the Cyber Investigations and Insider Threat department within the Cyber Defense organization within O&T Cyber Security. The CSO team directly engages talent and executive leadership on a weekly basis and as required during security events, an intern to this group will gain exposure to the impact of security controls and events on those groups. The major roadmap items are derived directly from the Cyber Long-Range Plan to increase the resiliency of our brand ambassadors and journalists in the Journalist Protection Program, enable and utilize Artificial Intelligence capabilities within the Cybersecurity group and protect the brand in general. Currently CSO is responsible for Digital Footprint Management, Social Media Security/Digital Risk Protection and Support, Negative Sentiment and Harassment and High-Risk Travel.

* **Cyber Security Engagement, Direct-to-Consumer**: Our Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) portfolio is a powerhouse collection of consumer-first brands, supported by media industry leaders, Comcast, NBCUniversal and Sky. When you join our team, you'll work across our dynamic portfolio including Peacock, NOW, SkyShowtime, Showmax, Hayu, and Universal+, powering streaming across more than 70 countries globally. The DTC Cyber Information Security Officer team is responsible for executing and contributing to the NBCU Cyber Security strategy and engaging with key leaders within the Direct-to-Consumer streaming businesses. We are a fast-paced, goal-oriented team that works to identify gaps in security controls for the applications developed by our streaming business areas.

* **Cyber Security Defense Ops – Threat 1:** The Detection team focuses on threat intelligence gathering, enrichment, correlation. The information gathered by intel is used to feed the detection engineering team, who are responsible for analyzing the log data, the intelligence, and building detection signatures for alerting. The hunting team proactively hunts through the environment and log data looking for abnormal, anomalous behavior that can be associated with actor techniques. The intern will support the Detection team and can work on threat intelligence, detection engineering, and threat hunting projects. A few of these projects will include developing intelligence requirements, enhancing threat hunting workflow and collaboration, developing emerging threat detection capabilities, and alert validation and testing to drive higher fidelity detections.

* **Cyber Security Engagement, Enterprise:** The O&T Cyber ISO team oversees Cyber alignment and partnership for O&T as a horizontal organization. Within this Cyber ISO, team leads and groups support many areas including Enterprise Services (Workplace, Legal/Privacy, Finance/HR), Media Services (Infrastructure, Global Networking, Production/Content), Platform Development/Engineering, and Enterprise Product. We directly support Enterprise Product, Ad Sales, Data Analytics, and Consumer Data which has interests and stakeholders aligned across multiple O&T teams and Business teams. An intern working in this scope would have wide visibility across NBCU with many partners on large cross-functional projects supporting Unified Architecture strategy, Ad Sales One Platform, NBCUnified Identity Solutions, and Enterprise Data Mesh.

* **Cyber Security Engagement, Film & TV Production**: The Film/TV/Production Information Security Office (ISO) group works as liaisons between Cyber/O&T and the business, and the intern will gain exposure across a broad range of technical and creative disciplines. We currently are involved in a production strategy initiative, reimagining how film and TV are made, leveraging secure technology workflows. The completion of this initiative will redefine the standard for production across NBCU Film/TV production and its assets. The intern will work within our team members to support a specific business group, working on compliance metrics, vendor reviews, vulnerability management and documenting business security applications.

* **Cyber Security Engagement, Operations & Technology**: The O&T ISO group supports our business partners across the entirety of O&T to improve security posture across enterprise and ensure that new workflows and infrastructure are being set up securely. An intern on the Media Services team would be exposed to any major security initiatives being worked on and to primary projects we are supporting with our ET and GND business partners.

* **Cyber Security Engagement, HR/Finance/Legal/Physical Securities**: Our team works across Human Resources, Finance, Legal, and Physical Securities and helps these business partners to stay engaged with our Cyber security services, programs, and technologies. An intern with our team will be able to learn cyber security-specific technologies, threat vectors, and best practices to secure our NBCU data. An intern will also have visibility on how these business groups operate across NBCU and within O&T. An intern with our team will help to engage with the business, track and help to remediate open security risks, report on our cyber metrics, and help facilitate security reviews for new tools/vendors.

* **Cyber Security Defense Ops – Threat 2.2**: The DTC Fraud Defense team is dedicated to securing the customers of our streaming and direct-to-consumer platforms (i.e. Peacock, Showmax, Showtime). They work alongside Incident Response to secure fraud, piracy, and compromises of the product. An intern will get exposure into web applications, how to investigate an attack/fraud, and the incident response process. The intern will prioritize and triage security alerts impacting the DTC products, investigate security events to identify attack vectors and impact, and identify opportunities for streamlining processes and assist in detection development.

* **Cyber Security Engagement, Engineering Experience**: Our team supports the security of the NBCU platform development/engineering experience and content supply organizations. This means that we facilitate secure development, planning, and operational support of the systems that NBCU uses to develop applications, create cloud architecture, and produce film and TV content. The intern will get to interface with the engineering teams at NBCU and assist in liaising between them and Cyber Security for various engagements, from analyzing proposed cloud architecture to helping find, report, and track vulnerabilities being closed in software and systems. You'll sync with other Cyber teams as well, getting to know each area and leveraging the security services they provide to help secure the PDEX and Content Supply business areas.

 **Qualifications** **Basic Requirements:**

* Must be actively enrolled in a degree-granting program at an accredited institution during the entire duration of the program (June 2025 through August 2025). May 2025 graduates are not eligible for our Summer 2025 Internship Program.
* Current class standing of sophomore or above (30 credits).
* Must be presently authorized to work for any employer in the United States and must not require work visa sponsorship from NBCUniversal now or in the future to retain authorization to work in the United States.
* Must be working from a location within a U.S. state during all hours worked.

  

For further clarification, candidates currently on any student or exchange visa (e.g. F-1 CPT, F-1 OPT, J-1, M-1) are not eligible to apply unless they will be able to change or adjust to another status that grants work authorization without NBCUniversal sponsorship.


NBCUniversal is an E-Verify company, requiring all employees to have an active Social Security number. Any candidate receiving an internship offer must complete I-9 form with Social Security number within 3 days of hire.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Students with class standing of junior or above preferred.
* Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above.
* Experience in Social Media.
* Data Analysis Course or other similar experience.
* Familiarity with Catfishing and other impersonation attacks.
* Pursuing a college degree in: Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Information Systems, Information Systems Security, Software Engineering, Information Systems Security, Computer Information Systems, Networking, etc.
* Familiarity with basic cyber security principles and concepts.
* Familiarity with MS Office (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word).
* Basic understanding of Security Information and Event Management (SIEM).
* Experience working with large data sets and data analytics.
* Splunk experience, Web/application experience, OWASP and MITRE TTP understanding, AI/ML understanding a plus.
* Basic understanding of business technology architecture (software, services, and concepts of on-network/off-network; understanding of on-premise/off-premise services; general user management and authentication concepts such as multi-factor auth, service accounts, and role-based access).

  

The hourly rate for undergraduate student interns is $30.00

The hourly rate for MBA student interns is $30.00

 **Additional Information**  

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision.

As a NBCUniversal Media Tech Intern, you will gain hands-on experience, allowing you to apply your classroom knowledge to practical situations. We offer a 2 day in-person orientation in our NY office where we bring all interns together to meet each other and various business leaders.


Students will experience firsthand how one of the largest media and entertainment companies in the world operates and delivers strategic, innovative solutions.


Areas of placement may include, but are not limited to:  



* **Data & Analytics, Corporate**: Our team manages the corporate analytics Portfolio along with the Unified architecture analytics and Supplier management analytics. The intern will gain exposure to the various initiatives within our organization. Some upcoming projects are Internal mobility for movements and promotions, Space planning for international locations, SuccessFactors BTP dashboard development, Legal Spending analytics etc. The intern will create and update dashboards/reports using AI tools such as copilot, collaborate with Product and stakeholders to fulfill Jira tickets, and shadow data engineers on projects to learn how to develop data pipelines.

* **Data & Analytics Content, Research**: Our team sits within the Data & Analytics organization, and we manage all research applications in the data and analytics team. We ingest data from all external providers and make it available to all internal consumers. Learning about RT applications will provide a great opportunity for career advancement in IT as we use many different technologies. The intern will assist in RT applications testing and minor development, documenting/updating WIKI (Confluence page) for RT applications testing process, and creating new DAG for data ingestion.

* **Post Production Engineering**: Our team is responsible for engineering, innovation, and support in the post production world for various business units within the company, both on-prem and in the cloud. We are in transit of on-boarding business to the Cloud, which comes with exciting infrastructure, automation, and workflow builds. This involves some exciting data handling too. The intern will support the data warehouse of Production and Archive data - This is a larger initiative to centralize the data from different production (AVID) sources and the archive (MAM) system. They’ll also support Power BI dashboards - To create user and business dashboards based on the existing data within the AIRE and Archive (MAM) systems.

 **Qualifications** **Basic Requirements:**

* Must be actively enrolled in a degree-granting program at an accredited institution during the entire duration of the program (June 2025 through August 2025). May 2025 graduates are not eligible for our Summer 2025 Internship Program.
* Current class standing of sophomore or above (30 credits).
* Must be presently authorized to work for any employer in the United States and must not require work visa sponsorship from NBCUniversal now or in the future to retain authorization to work in the United States.
* Must be working from a location within a U.S. state during all hours worked.


For further clarification, candidates currently on any student or exchange visa (e.g. F-1 CPT, F-1 OPT, J-1, M-1) are not eligible to apply unless they will be able to change or adjust to another status that grants work authorization without NBCUniversal sponsorship.


NBCUniversal is an E-Verify company, requiring all employees to have an active Social Security number. Any candidate receiving an internship offer must complete I-9 form with Social Security number within 3 days of hire.

**Desired Characteristics**:

* Students with class standing of junior or above preferred.
* Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above.
* Basic knowledge in Python and SQL.
* Familiarity with Visualization tools.
* Experience with data analysis using SQL and Python.
* Experience with SQL, Data Modeling, Data Pipeline, and Power BI will be a plus.

The hourly rate for MBA student interns is $30.00

* **UX Research Intern, EP Architecture & Design**: Our UX team supports product design across multiple business functions, including Content Supply Chain, Tech Foundation, and Corporate Core. The UX Research intern will receive exposure to design operations at an enterprise-scale, including UX processes & design workflows. This role does not involve consumer-facing applications or consumer research. The intern will conduct competitive research and comparative analysis for enterprise-grade UX patterns, document and present findings and usage guidelines with clear, concise communication (written & verbal), compare and document equivalent UX patterns across multiple design system frameworks, e.g. Angular, React, Salesforce, SAP, ServiceNow, map design decisions to best practices via research & documentation, contribute to ongoing project initiatives, e.g. discovery documentation, site maps, user flows, and usability/accessibility audits.

NBCUniversal is an E-Verify company, requiring all employees to have an active Social Security number. Any candidate receiving an internship offer must complete I-9 form with Social Security number within 3 days of hire.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Students with class standing of junior or above preferred.
* Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above.
* Working knowledge of FigJam; basic knowledge of Figma.
* Experience with UX research methodologies and data analytics.
* Familiarity with design systems, especially Material Design, is a big plus. Basic knowledge of Accessibility a plus.
* A portfolio of case studies, including research projects and writing samples (please include link in application).
* Enrolled in an academic program with a focus on UX Research, Human Computer Interaction, or equivalent field.

Here at NBCU, we strive to be on the forefront of leading-edge technology and are seeking a savvy troop of technologists we call Media Tech Interns.


Our program exposes students to technical opportunities across NBCUniversal’s Operations & Technology organizations and serves as a main pipeline into our Rotational Associate Programs. As a NBCUniversal Media Tech Intern, you will gain hands-on experience, allowing you to apply your classroom knowledge to practical situations. We offer a 2 day in-person orientation in our NY office where we bring all interns together to meet each other and various business leaders.


Students will experience firsthand how one of the largest media and entertainment companies in the world operates and delivers strategic, innovative solutions.


Areas of placement may include, but are not limited to:  



* **Enterprise Product, Architecture & Design:** Product Operations is an org within Enterprise Product meant to provide process improvement and automation using a data-driven mindset. Over the past year we have focused on increasing our data integrity to allow us to tell better story while also integrating our in-house applications with an app called Pendo that provides Product Analytics to our Product teams to help us make better decisions. From March to August, we also ran a Transformation project called "Ways of Working" where we hosted workshops with 200+ leaders across O&T to provide feedback on which pieces of their job are most challenging today. We have been analyzing that data and are entering a season of change, experimentation, and growth as we pursue solutions accordingly. There are 3 Product Analysts on our team that drive these functions forward. This intern would be exposed to perhaps one of the biggest and widest spread initiatives O&T has seen in a long time, Ways of Working will touch Business Solutions, Enterprise Product, Enterprise Engineering, Media Operations and more. We are leading the charge to help us all get "better at working", examples include reducing meeting fatigue, improving global taxonomy across all groups, visibility into LRP and how to set proper OKRs. In addition, they would have a front row seat to watch a brand-new function get stood up and socialized (Product Delivery) inside of a brand-new org (Product Operations) that is only 14 months old. Product Ops has been a long time in the making to empower Product to build good Products and not worry about the in between. We'd be thrilled to welcome another individual to help and be a critical piece of building this new org.

* **Enterprise Product, Content Supply Chain:** NBCUniversal’s Enterprise Product Team builds products that provide essential capabilities to organizations throughout NBCUniversal. The team leverages deep relationships with our business engagement and engineering counterparts to build cohesive, end-to-end solutions for their clients or users. Our team is aligned around critical NBCU functions such as Scheduling & Distribution, and Entitlements. We work with Business Units, Business Solutions, Software Engineering, Video Engineering, Infrastructure Engineering, Architecture, Multiple Operations teams, DTC to deliver impactful business outcomes. As a part of the Product team, the individual will work on destination architecture products in the Scheduling & Distribution domain.

 **Qualifications** **Basic Requirements:**

* Must be actively enrolled in a degree-granting program at an accredited institution during the entire duration of the program (June 2025 through August 2025). May 2025 graduates are not eligible for our Summer 2025 Internship Program.

* Must be presently authorized to work for any employer in the United States and must not require work visa sponsorship from NBCUniversal now or in the future to retain authorization to work in the United States.

NBCUniversal is an E-Verify company, requiring all employees to have an active Social Security number. Any candidate receiving an internship offer must complete I-9 form with Social Security number within 3 days of hire.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Students with class standing of junior or above preferred.
* Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above.
* Product or Technical Project Manager background preferred.
* Strong math and analytic skills.
* Basic skills in technical writing, API management, Data analytics, Jira experience, Agile methodology.

title: Legal Receptionist & Switchboard ($23/hr)
description:

title: Construction Project Coordinator
description:
\\*\\*\\*Job interviews will be conducted in person at our Greenwich, CT office\\*\\*\\*

**Location:** Greenwich, CT

**About Us:** Old World Craftsmen LLC is a design-build and residential remodeling company specializing in high-end renovations. We are seeking a highly motivated Construction Project Coordinator to support and assist in managing our projects from the office.

**Role Overview:** As a Construction Project Coordinator, you will primarily work from the office, providing essential support in blueprint analysis, proposal preparation, and financial oversight. This role involves assisting with various aspects of project management and occasionally visiting job sites to ensure smooth operations. If you thrive in a behind-the-scenes role and enjoy coordinating project details, this position is perfect for you.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Blueprint Analysis and Proposal Preparation:** Interpret and analyze blueprints to help develop accurate proposals. Evaluate subcontractor bids to ensure they align with project requirements and budgets. Assist the owner with defining project scopes, pricing, and preparing proposals.
* **Project Management Support:** Assist with pre-project activities, including scheduling meetings and video conferences and managing building permit procurement. During the project, support change order management, project scheduling, and subcontractor coordination. Conduct occasional site visits to monitor progress and ensure projects stay on track. Facilitate client communication and follow-up.
* **Materials and Inventory Management:** Help with the procurement of materials, coordination of job site deliveries, and management of inventory to ensure projects run smoothly.
* **Financial Oversight:** Analyze job profitability. Manage project invoicing and work with the outsourced accounts payable team on vendor installment payments and reconciliation. Track insurance certificates and address any billing issues as needed.
* **Administrative Support:** Manage office records, supplies, and insurance policies. Review timesheets, upload payroll files to QuickBooks biweekly, and coordinate with IT support for minor computer issues. Provide documentation and follow up to ensure the completion of yearly insurance audits.
* **Project Closeout:** Assist in obtaining Certificates of Occupancy, ensuring all project documentation is complete, and addressing any final client requirements.
* **Client and Vendor Relations:** Support communication with clients and vendors to resolve issues.

**Qualifications:**

* Experience in construction project management with strong skills in blueprint reading and proposal preparation.
* Excellent organizational, time management, and problem-solving abilities.
* Effective oral and written communication, detail-oriented, and able to multitask.

description:

THE COST ESTIMATOR COLLECTS AND ASSEMBLES THE COST INPUTS AND DATA TO PRODUCE PRE-CONSTRUCTION PRICE BIDS AND PROJECT CHANGE ORDERS. THE COST ESTIMATOR WORKS CLOSELY WITH EXTERNAL SUPPLIERS AND SUBCONTRACTORS TO APPROXIMATE THE COST OF COMPLETING A PROJECT, TAKING INTO ACCOUNT LABOR, MATERIALS, AND LEAD TIMES.

AS AN ENTRY LEVEL ESTIMATOR, YOU WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH OUR FIELD OPERATIONS FOR EXPERIENCED INPUT ON ESTIMATES.

* UTILIZING EMAIL AND PHONE SKILLS TO COMMUNICATE WITH SUB-CONTRACTORS, VENDOR REPS, AND MANUFACTURER’S DURING THE ESTIMATING PROCESS.
* ABILITY TO WORK INDEPENDENTLY AFTER TRAINING WITH LEAD ESTIMATORS AND/OR WITHIN A GROUP SETTING TO COMPLETE ESTIMATES IN A TIMELY MANNER.
* USE DETAILED SPREADSHEETS AND COMPANY-APPROVED FORMULAS TO CALCULATE PROJECTED COSTS FOR IDENTIFIED SALES OPPORTUNITIES
* ANALYZE CUSTOMER REQUIREMENTS, REQUESTS FOR PROPOSALS(RFP’S), TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS AND DRAWING SETS TO IDENTIFY REQUIRED MATERIALS, SCOPE, SUBTRADES AND ALL RESOURCES REQUIRED TO PRODUCE TURNKEY PRICING

title: Café Assistant
company: The Art Students League of New York
description:
**The Art Students League of New York is looking for a Part-Time Cafe Assistant.**

The CAFÉ Assistant is responsible for assisting the *Café Atelier* team, ensuring consistent and exceptional customer experiences, helping manage inventory and product stocking, adhering to opening and closing procedures, and maintaining the café's overall appearance and hygiene standards.

In this position you will help deliver exceptional customer service, address equipment issues, handle the cash register, and ensure work efficiency working side-by-side with Café management and work-study employees. Keeping the refrigerator fully stocked, and regularly cleaning behind equipment are also part of your duties. Additionally, you'll be responsible for ensuring a clean and welcoming café environment.

**Essential Responsibilities and Duties:**

This position is responsible for:

* Food handling and light preparation.
* Coffee and tea service.
* Payment handling.
* Maintaining a well-stocked café and upholding hygiene standards.

**Café Hours of Operation:**   
Monday – Thursday, 8:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.; Friday and Saturday, 8:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

**Shift Hours:** subject to change based on work needs.  
Saturdays: 8:00 a.m.– 4:00 p.m.; Tuesdays and Thursdays: 8:00 a.m. – 1:00 p.m.

**UNIQUE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS JOB:**

* Availability on Saturdays is a MUST.
* Possession of a NYC Food Handlers certificate is REQUIRED.
* 1-2 years' experience as a food service handler in a similar restaurant or cafe setting.
* Register/cash handling experience needed.
* Strong communication and customer service skills, a team-oriented approach and proficiency in kitchen management are necessary to provide exceptional customer service aligned with Café Manager philosophy and standards.

**Degree(s) or Certificate Required:**  
Possession of a NYC Food Handlers certificate

**Years of Experience Desired:**  
1-2 years’ experience as a food service handler in a similar restaurant or café setting or cafe setting preferred.

**Computer Experience:**  
PC proficiency a plus (Excel and MSWord)

**Core Skills/Abilities Required:**  
Strong communication and customer service skills, a team-oriented approach, and proficiency in kitchen management.

**ABOUT THE ART STUDENTS LEAGUE:**  
The Art Students League of New York was founded in 1875 and remains an institution run by artists in support of artists. The League fulfills its mission by offering accessible, affordable, high-quality education and instruction in painting, drawing, printmaking, sculpture, metal work and mixed media in the context of an Atelier system. There are no entrance requirements, degrees or set curriculum. Students come for a hands-on studio education accessible to anyone who truly aspires to develop as an artist, whether they seek to pursue a profession in the fine arts or are just beginning their artistic journey. Each month, students of all ages, backgrounds and skill levels study on-site at The League or through The League’s *e-telier* online class program.Many famous artists who have shaped the vocabulary of art worldwide have been instructors, lecturers, and students at the League. They include Georgia O'Keeffe, Romare Bearden, Jackson Pollock, Carmen Herrera, Robert Rauschenberg, Adrian Piper, Louise Bourgeois, Alexander Calder, James Rosenquist and Ai-Weiwei, among many others.

Web site: www.theartstudentsleague.org

Social Media: https://www.instagram.com/aslnyc/

**THE LEAGUE'S COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND ACCESS (IDEA):**  
*The Art Students League is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. The Art Students League complies with all applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.*

**Principals only. Recruiters, please do not contact or call.**

title: Assistant Program Director
description:
\\*\\*Job Title: Events Coordinator\\*\\*

\\*\\*Position Type:\\*\\* Full-Time

\\*\\*About Us:\\*\\*

The Play Place is a premier destination for unforgettable birthday celebrations. Our venue is designed to host a variety of themed birthday parties, offering a unique and fun-filled experience for guests of all ages. We are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic Events Coordinator to join our team and help create magical moments for our clients.

\\*\\*Job Summary:\\*\\*

The Events Coordinator will be responsible for planning, organizing, and overseeing birthday parties and events at our venue. This role requires exceptional customer service skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently. The ideal candidate will have a passion for creating memorable experiences and a strong background in event planning or coordination.

\\*\\*Key Responsibilities:\\*\\*

- \\*\\*Client Consultation:\\*\\* Meet with clients to understand their needs, preferences, and vision for their event. Provide recommendations and ideas to enhance their experience.

- \\*\\*Event Planning:\\*\\* Plan and coordinate all aspects of birthday parties, including themes, decorations, entertainment, catering, and activities.

- \\*\\*Vendor Management:\\*\\* Liaise with external vendors, such as entertainers, caterers, and decorators, to ensure timely delivery and setup of services.

- \\*\\*Budget Management:\\*\\* Develop and manage event budgets, ensuring cost-effective solutions while maintaining high-quality standards.

- \\*\\*Scheduling:\\*\\* Coordinate event schedules, including booking the venue, arranging setup and teardown times, and ensuring all staff and vendors are informed of timelines.

- \\*\\*On-Site Coordination:\\*\\* Oversee the setup, execution, and teardown of events. Ensure everything runs smoothly and address any issues that arise promptly.

- \\*\\*Customer Service:\\*\\* Provide exceptional customer service throughout the planning process and during the event. Address client questions, concerns, and special requests with professionalism and enthusiasm.

- \\*\\*Administrative Tasks:\\*\\* Maintain detailed records of all events, including contracts, payment schedules, and client communications. Prepare reports and updates for management as required.

- \\*\\*Marketing Support:\\*\\* Collaborate with the marketing team to promote the venue and its services. Assist in creating promotional materials and participating in marketing events as needed.

- \\*\\*Team Collaboration:\\*\\* Work closely with other team members, including event staff, to ensure a seamless and cohesive event experience.

\\*\\*Qualifications:\\*\\*

- Bachelor’s degree in Event Management, Hospitality, Business Administration, or a related field preferred.

- Proven experience in event planning or coordination, preferably in a hospitality or entertainment setting.

- Strong organizational and time management skills.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to work under pressure and handle multiple events simultaneously.

- Creative problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and event management software.

\\*\\*Benefits:\\*\\*

- Competitive salary & 401k

- Paid time off and holidays

- Opportunities for professional development and growth

- Fun and dynamic work environment

\\*\\*How to Apply:\\*\\*

Interested candidates should submit their resume, cover letter, and any relevant portfolio or work samples to [email address] by [application deadline]. Please include "Events Coordinator Application - [Your Name]" in the subject line.

The Play Place is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Construction Operations Manager
description:
Old World Craftsmen LLC, a design-build & residential remodeling company is seeking a highly motivated candidate looking for a growth position as a lead role in managing and executing high end renovations in lower Westchester & Connecticut. Old World Craftsmen has been in business for 25 years, focusing on a teamwork approach to delivering impeccable service and craftsmanship from concept to completion. Looking for a candidate who enjoys varied daily work, and wants to be the owner’s “right hand” in running and improving a successful business with integrity. Profit sharing after proven performance.

Be the owner’s right hand in managing high end residential remodel projects:

* Assist in managing construction projects including client communication & follow up
* Work as a team with the owner on pricing and drafting of proposals
* Management and Tracking of change orders
* Assist with materials procurement and coordination of job site deliveries
* Assist with job & subcontractor scheduling, facilitating subcontractor site entry
* Building permit and Cert. of Occupancy procurement, licensing requirements
* Schedule & coordinate inspections; at times meet inspectors
* Scheduling of site meetings & video conferences
* Site visits as required to maintain contact with job site activities
* Stock construction material inventory management
* Monitor daily backup, troubleshoot minor computer issues, coordinate computer support

Support our business, clients, outsourced A/P and payroll company in the business finances:

* Monitor milestones to trigger invoicing and subcontractor payments
* Job analysis for profitability
* Workers Comp and Liability Insurance tracking and certificates
* Responding to client calls/requests, provide reports and explanations to resolve billing issues
* Maintain office records, supplies & annual insurance policies
* Review and send timesheets to outsourced payroll and update Quickbooks biweekly
* Work together with outsourced accounts payable team handling: vendor installment payments, bill payment and reconciliation

**Qualifications:**

* Construction project management skills
* Independent time management and understands priorities and deadlines
* Driven to look for cost savings and improvement in profitability
* Excellent task tracking and independent follow up habits
* Excellent oral & written communication skills
* Demonstrated high level of inter-personal skills and the ability to communicate and deal with vendors & top level customers
* Must be accurate and detail oriented
* Able to multi-task and problem solve

* Exposure to small business finance & experience with Quickbooks
