title: H&M Sales Associate - Queens Center Mall
description:
**Job Description** **About the Role**

At H&M, as a Retail Sales Associate you will be advising our customers and keeping them in style! A Retail Sales Associate, or Sales Advisor, as referred to internally, is responsible for delivering the Best Customer Experience that contributes to the store’s sales and profit. As a Retail Sales Associate, you will always put customers first, offer assistance, and share your Product and Fashion knowledge. You will create an environment that is easy for our customers to shop through Store Operations and Great Garment Care. By sharing knowledge and skills with colleagues, you will actively contribute to creating a Best Team to meet our customers’ expectations. This role will work in accordance with H&M standards, policies, procedures, and legal requirements.


This position reports to our Department Managers and has a dotted line to the Department Supervisor.

**Your Day to Day\\***

* Actively greet and engage with our customers in the service areas and on the sales floor to provide the best customer experience
* Support in the maintenance of a neat and tidy sales floor to ensure a positive shopping experience inclusive of folding, hanging, displaying, and merchandising garments per H&M guidelines to maximize selling opportunities
* Unload delivery truck, receive, open, and unpack merchandise and label merchandise with security tags within efficiency timeline goals
* Actively process, stock, and replenish garments on sales floor and stock room
* Ring on the register, report and handle all required transactions, issue receipts, and fold and place merchandise in appropriate bag following the register best practices routine
* Eager to educate and promote our H&M Loyalty program to our customers
* Share your knowledge and skills with your colleagues, offering help where needed to build a positive working environment
* Work in accordance with H&M standards and local legislation with health & safety and security routines, to guarantee you, your colleagues, and customer safety at all times
* Follow all procedures and routines regarding safety, security, and administrative processes in all areas of the store

  

**Qualifications** **Who You Are**

* Passionate for customer service and helping people find their style
* A multi-tasker who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment
* Inclusive, positive, creative, and willing to learn on the job!
* A team player with a flexible approach
* You have the ability to lift in excess of 20 pounds
* Ability to stand for long periods of time, bend, stretch, engage in repetitive motions, push, pull and carry items (mannequins, clothing, totes, torsos, etc.) for a short distance
* Ability to climb a ladder and use a step stool
* Must be able to work a flexible work schedule including nights and weekends

**Why You’ll Love Working for H&M**

* Dynamic, team-driven work environment with a group of unique, diverse and kind individuals.
* Endless growth & development opportunities.
* Dress your personality. We encourage you to dress your personality, all day, every day.
* Did we mention our discount at H&M, &Other Stories, and COS?

  

**Additional Information** **Job Status:** Hourly, Non-Exempt

**EEOC Code:** SLS

**Compensation:** *Sales Associates Pay Rate $17.50 per hour\\*\\**

* This job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities assigned for this job at the company’s discretion.


\\*\\*H&M, in good faith, believes that this posted rate of compensation is the accurate range for this role at this location at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future.

**Benefits:**

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

**Inclusion & Diversity:**


H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence, all diversity dimensions are considered in our recruitment process.


We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.

**Company Description:**

H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

**Store Roles Assessment:**

*We want to inform you that we use automated decision-making for skill-based recruitment within some of our stores. This means that your responses will be evaluated and scored by an assessment tool that applies predefined criteria set by H&M Group.*  

  

*The purpose of the assessment tool is to ensure a fair and objective assessment of your skills and suitability for the role. This is validated through strategic human oversight and has been audited according to New York legislation. You can read more about the result* *here**. You’ll be able to provide feedback after the assessment and you always have the opportunity to ask questions.*  

  

*If you have any difficulties or concerns with the current assessment method, you can request for an alternative method of assessment. Please contact us at* *recruitmentsupport@hm.com* *as soon as possible to discuss your options. We’ll try our best to meet your needs.*
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Administrative Assistant/Accounting
description:
**Accounting Administrative Assistant**

Branchburg, NJ

**About Us**

We're a small, yet mighty family-owned business on the lookout for an exceptional individual to join our team. At WWM your voice and creative ideas matter; being innovative and having a human element to our brand is our mission.

**Why you should join the team?**

1. You share our values; Heart, Own It, Teamwork, Drive, Grow, Humble, Smart, and Trust.

2. You are enthusiastic, outgoing and passionate about your work making an impact.

3. You are a self-starter and have a great work ethic.

4. You thrive in a team environment and work hard to support your teammates.

5. You love to learn and grow and welcome new things to help improve yourself.

6. You welcome constructive feedback and want to always find a way to be better.

**Who We Are**

At WWM, we are an essential piece to keeping the world flowing. We are a pipe, valves, and fittings supplier to the maritime and industrial markets, looking for a **Administrative Assistant** to join our Accounting badass team. Since 1970, World Wide Metric has continued to grow. With four regional offices across North America, we have progressively developed into a worldwide competitor.

If you want to learn, be challenged, and grow professionally you are in the right place!

**Status:** Part Time Position (Onsite)(20hrs/wk – AM hours)

**Schedule:** Mon-Fri 8a-12noon or 9a-1pm.

**The Perks**

**We offer an attractive compensation package, which includes:**

· Paid time off

· Tuition Reimbursement

· Retirement plan and a host of other benefits

**JOB PURPOSE**

Assist the accounting team in departmental administrative duties.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITY SUMMARY**

*Perform administrative duties relating to Accounting:*

· Ensure invoices/credit memos have been mailed, emailed, and uploaded to customer portals for payment

· Print, match and file all invoices & credit memos

· Create labels and folders for all new & existing customers and vendors

· Handle all customer invoice special requirements

· Light data entry as needed within the department

*Perform administrative duties relating to Customer Service:*

· Answer the telephone in a warm, welcoming and professional manner

· Assist customers with questions or direct them to the appropriate person

· Provide back-up to others in the department

· Additional projects as assigned

**REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES**

**Education/Credentials**

Associates degree in Accounting or related field preferred but not required

title: IDD Training Coordinator
description:
**Community Options, Inc.** is a national non-profit agency providing services to individuals with disabilities in 12 states.We are now hiring a **Training Coordinator** to support our operations in **Hillsborough, NJ.** The Training Coordinator is responsible for developing a comprehensive training program to teach staff how to support individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities. This person will maintain the training program, which includes conducting trainings and ensuring staff follow state regulations and company policy. ***Union, Somerset, Middlesex counties are covered.*** *Starting pay is $45,000-$50,000/annually***Responsibilities**

* Maintain and update training tracking spreadsheet and recordkeeping system
* Maintain current list of certified trainers and notify trainers when certifications are due for renewal and secures documentation upon completion for trainer records
* Coordinate training logistics, including assigning trainers, managing training material, tracking attendance sheets and handling training room schedule
* Maintain and continuously audit all training documentation, ensuring compliance with state and company requirements
* May conduct in-house trainings
* Represent Community Options at community information/education events including job fairs
* Provide support to Recruiting Coordinator with orientation and new hire processes including background checks and interviews
* May act in the Recruiting Coordinator's absence to support onboarding and orientation of new hires
* May manage one or more training staff. Manages performance and completes staff evaluations for any direct reports
* Communicates non-compliance of required training to supervisors and employees and work to resolve issue
* Maintains trainer certifications in the following areas: Medication Administration, Crisis Intervention and CPR/First Aid
* Confer with direct supervisor to gain knowledge of specific work situations requiring employees to better understand changes in policies, procedures, regulations, and technologies. Updates training to meet ongoing needs
* Schedule and conduct training sessions covering specified areas, such as, new employee orientation, on-the-job training, consumer service, safety practices, promotional and leadership development
* Maintain tracking information and sends notice to staff when they are due for training, or other documents required for state regulations
* Follow through to obtain documentation for staff records
* Oversees all trainers
* Employees must cooperate with the licensee and department staff in any inspection, inquiry or investigation
* Other duties as assigned

**Minimum Requirements**

* Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field or
* High School diploma/GED plus three years of training experience
* Certified Trainer: Crisis Intervention
* Medication Administration Trainer
* CPR/First Aid Certified Instructor
* Valid driver’s license with a satisfactory driving record
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent time management skills

**Working Conditions** 

* May be required to travel utilizing own vehicle

**Why Community Options?**

* Competitive Insurance Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)
* Paid Holidays—Including a Birthday Holiday
* Generous PTO
* Employee Incentive & Discount Programs
* 403b Retirement Plan
* Incredible career growth opportunities

*Community Options is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V*

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

* IDD: 1 year (Required)

description:
**About Us**

Slater Slater Schulman LLP is a prominent full-service law firm with over 40 years of experience representing survivors of catastrophic and traumatic events. Our nationally renowned attorneys are committed to ensuring the best results for our clients through persistence and zealous representation. We have achieved successful resolutions in some of the most challenging cases in the industry, including 9/11 World Trade Center litigation, Child Victims Act, mass torts, pharmaceutical drug litigation, product liability litigation, environmental litigation, employment and labor law, medical malpractice, and personal injury.

**Position Overview**

We are seeking a full-time attorney with 5+ years experience in plaintiff's personal injury litigation. This role may involve assisting in the Child Victims Act litigation. The successful candidate should be capable of managing his/her own caseload with supervision.

Must have experience drafting complaints, bills of particulars, discovery responses and demands; conducting depositions; and capable of reviewing medical records.

Courtroom experience preferred, but trial experience not expected.

The candidate must be well organized, possess excellent oral and written communication skills and be comfortable corresponding and communicating with clients, insurance carriers, opposing counsel, and courts.

title: Operations Manager (Administrative)
description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!
When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.
**Job Description:**

When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for. We need your expertise to support onsite work in Hamilton, NJ in this full-time role.


**Job Summary**

The **Project Lead (Manager of Administrative Operations)** is responsible for overseeing the administrative and logistical operations within the NJ State Inspection Program's Hamilton Office. This role includes managing a diverse team responsible for field services, customer service, warehouse, inventory, and purchasing. The Operations Manager (Administrative) ensures that all support functions run efficiently to meet the program’s operational needs, improve service quality, and maintain high standards of performance.


**Key Responsibilities**

* **Administrative Oversight** : Manage all aspects of administrative operations within the Hamilton Office, ensuring efficient processes and compliance with program standards.
* **Team Leadership** : Directly supervise the Field Services Manager, Customer Service Team Lead, Warehouse Manager, Inventory Manager, and Purchasing Manager. Provide leadership, guidance, and performance management to support team goals and program objectives.
* **Field Services Management** : Oversee the Field Services Manager, who is responsible for coordinating all field-related work, including repairs, maintenance, and facilities management. Ensure that field operations are conducted efficiently and align with program safety and quality standards.
* **Customer Service Excellence** : Collaborate with the Customer Service Team Lead to enhance customer support services, ensuring high-quality interactions and efficient resolution of customer inquiries and issues.
* **Warehouse & Inventory Management** : Supervise the Warehouse and Inventory teams to maintain accurate inventory levels, including management of critical items such as inspection stickers. Ensure proper tracking, storage, and distribution of all inventory items.
* **Purchasing Oversight** : Manage the Purchasing team to ensure timely procurement of goods and services necessary for program operations. Oversee vendor relationships, budget compliance, and cost control measures.
* **Operational Efficiency** : Identify and implement process improvements across all administrative functions to optimize resource use, reduce costs, and enhance service delivery.
* **Reporting & Compliance** : Ensure that all administrative activities comply with relevant regulations and program standards. Oversee reporting functions to provide accurate and timely data to support decision-making.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration** : Work closely with other managers, including those overseeing lane operations and regional activities, to ensure administrative support aligns with broader operational goals.

**Key Qualifications**

* **Education** : Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Operations Management, or related field; or equivalent experience.
* **Experience** : Minimum of 5 years of experience in an operations management or administrative leadership role, with a track record of managing diverse teams and complex operations.
* **Skills** :
	+ Strong leadership and people management skills.
	+ Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
	+ Effective communication and collaboration with cross-functional teams.
	+ Experience in inventory management, customer service processes, and purchasing.
	+ Ability to analyze data and implement process improvements.
	+ Strong familiarity with MS Office including Visio (MS Project is a plus)
* **Preferred Qualifications** : Experience in state inspection programs or similar operational environments. Familiarity with logistics, maintenance, and procurement processes.

**Key Competencies**

* **Leadership** : Ability to lead and inspire a team of managers and staff, driving performance and accountability.
* **Operational Excellence** : Skilled in optimizing processes to enhance efficiency, quality, and service delivery.
* **Problem Solving** : Proactive in identifying operational challenges and implementing effective solutions.
* **Collaboration** : Works effectively across departments, fostering strong relationships and ensuring alignment of administrative functions with program needs.
* **Adaptability** : Thrives in a dynamic environment with shifting priorities, demonstrating resilience and flexibility.

**Minimum Clearance Required to Start:**

Not Applicable/None
This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.
For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.
Salary Range:


$96,400.00 - $168,700.00
We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!
Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.
We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

title: Healthcare Software Sales Representative
description:
**Company Mission:**

Nonnatech is revolutionizing healthcare by harnessing the power of AI and advanced analytics to proactively identify potential health challenges, improving patient outcomes and optimizing healthcare resources. At Nonnatech, we generate actionable clinical insights that empower providers and patients to focus on early intervention and prevention. Our goal is to make healthcare more accessible, efficient, and personalized for all. We are leading the way in how medical groups leverage technology and real-time data to care for patients beyond the traditional office setting. Our goal is to streamline remote patient monitoring, making it more efficient and effective, while enhancing both clinical outcomes and financial performance for our clients**.**

**Job Summary:**

Nonnatech is a fast growing virtual health monitoring and analytics company looking for a highly motivated and driven team member and leader to help take our company sales to the next level. Nonnatech is hiring a Sales Account Executive position to oversee all sales and provide additional national sales lead generation and support for signature customer segments. We seek a dynamic Sales Representative who is passionate about healthcare and technology to drive growth and bring our remote health monitoring solutions to medical practices, hospitals, and healthcare organizations.

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in not just meeting, but exceeding sales targets This position will report directly to the CEO with accountability to the C-suite. The candidate for this position must have a minimum of 8 – 10 years of proven sales experience selling at the senior management, executive and enterprise levels. Health IT or related sales is preferred, but not required for the right candidate. This team member must be creative, flexible and disciplined able to work successfully independently and with a team to manage complex, time-sensitive customer needs, collaborating well with internal team members and external customers in a timely manner focused on an exceptional customer experience.

The Sales Account Executive must possess expert relationship management abilities with excellent oral and written presentation and negotiation skills able to effectively communicate at all levels of an organization. The position will be a part to full-time opportunity – based on market need – and is a remote position that will work from home with minimum local travel required to meet with select customers. Pay will be based on experience with a highly incentivized bonus structure for meeting sales goals and related KPIs.

**Position Responsibilities:**

**Primary Job Role:** The Sales Account Executive’s primary role is to sell Nonnatech’s remote patient monitoring technology software products and related services in a defined market and territory. This person will own the process to proactively identify and close qualified, existing and new opportunities. The Account Executive will lead accounts including the entire sales process from business development and prospecting through to contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support. The focus is on an exceptional customer experience that drives overall company growth and market position.

**Key responsibilities and personal traits expected to be successful in this role include**:

* **Prospect & Build Relationships:**

Proactively identify and target potential healthcare providers, clinics, hospitals, and long-term care facilities. Build and nurture relationships with key decision-makers such as physicians, practice managers, and administrators.

* **Sales Strategy Execution:**

Develop and execute a strategic sales plan tailored to healthcare providers' needs. Understand their pain points, demonstrate the value of our RPM solutions, and guide them through the sales cycle from initial contact to contract signing.

* **Product Expertise:**

Master our RPM product offerings and be able to articulate their value and benefits in terms of patient care, clinical outcomes, and financial efficiency. Provide potential clients with product demos, presentations, and technical specifications. Lead and participate in platform system training and testing as needed to support sales

* **Client Education:**

Act as a trusted advisor, educating healthcare providers about how remote patient monitoring enhances patient outcomes and operational efficiency. Collaborate with marketing to provide relevant sales materials, white papers, and case studies. Participate in customer and end user testing and feedback and participate in performance improvement processes as needed

* **Pipeline Management & Reporting:**

Utilize CRM systems to manage sales pipelines, track leads, and provide accurate forecasts. Report regularly on sales activity, revenue performance, and market trends.

* **Collaboration with Teams:**

Work closely with marketing, product, and customer success teams to align strategies and ensure a smooth onboarding process for new clients. Provide feedback from the field to help improve product offerings and client experiences while constantly creating a culture of sales excellence and integrity.

* **Achieve Sales Targets:**

Meet or exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets, focusing on new client acquisition and expansion within existing accounts. Develop and maintain a comprehensive and proactive market and account management plan aligned to the sales pipeline with clear goals and KPIs. Proactively manage an executive account pipeline with a clear vision and process for expanding footprint markets and growing the current customer base

* **Post-Sales Support:**

Ensure a seamless transition from the sales process to implementation by coordinating closely with the operations team. Maintain a strong relationship with clients post-sale to facilitate future upsell opportunities.

* Able to quickly adapt and build relationships at all levels of the customer organization
* Demonstrate business impact and return on investment able to sell Nonnatech’s services in a compelling manner focused on improving healthcare outcomes for our customers
* Actively participate in iterating the sales process to find new approaches to knock down barriers and accelerate all points of the sales cycle from lead generation through to contract execution
* Serve as an ambassador for Nonnatech building a positive brand in the healthcare industry
* Work directly with customers to accelerate adoption and expansion where appropriate
* Ensure promises are kept and made and delivered to all Nonnatech stakeholders reliably, timely, transparently, and cost effectively
* Follow all IT security protocols and processes to ensure data security for all data transactions per HIPAA and protection of company intellectual property and data assets
* Actively participate in regular sales performance reviews conducted with the executive team to drive improved business performance
* Ensure that the current and future service requirements and business needs of external customers are identified, understood, and documented and shared with the team as needed
* Contribute to the development of the sales strategic plan and roadmap with executive team
* Support delivery of project implementations and operational support commitments
* Participate in developing sales policies, procedures, marketing strategies and best practices
* Stay updated on virtual health market trends and emerging healthcare technologies
* Stay updated on the competitive and market landscape
* Ensure all sales strategies and processes meet or exceed company-wide goals
* Oversee relationships or processes with select vendors or service providers as directed by the executive team

**Preferred Work Experience**:

* Minimum bachelor’s degree in healthcare, business management/administration or related field(s) – advanced degree a plus
* Minimum 8 – 10 years of experience – sales in healthcare a major plus - with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding targets, preferably in healthcare or SaaS
* Start-up experience a plus with a healthcare company
* Healthcare experience with knowledge of HIPAA and related data security policies
* Experience leading national sales initiatives with proven record of consistent year-over-year sales growth
* Familiarity with CRM and prospecting tools
* Self-Motivated with a proactive approach to identifying and pursuing new opportunities
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex concepts in a clear and compelling manner
* Previous experience in remote patient monitoring, telehealth or electronic health/population health platform sales will be receive the topmost consideration

**Pay Transparency**

The estimated starting base salary range for this position is $70,000 to $100,000 USD with uncapped commission, performance and milestone bonuses. Opportunity for career growth within a fast-paced, innovative company.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Application Question(s):

* How much revenue growth (percentage is fine) and other metrics can you share that you were directly responsible for per quarter for the last 2 years. Feel free to explain any fluctuations.

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Sales: 6 years (Required)

Location:

* New York, NY (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Lead Security Coordinator
description:
**Company Description**  

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.


Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

 **Job Description**  

The Lead Security Coordinator is a member of the Global Security Organization and is responsible for supporting the Guest Reception Supervisor at NBCUniversal’s Corporate Headquarters in Midtown Manhattan, NY. They will report to the Manager, Guest Reception.


What You’ll Do:

* Greet employees and their guests with courtesy and professionalism. Review access permissions and process appropriated identification in a timely manner
* Answer phones and respond to email requests courteously and professionally
* Prioritize customer service and guest satisfaction as a representative of 30 Rockefeller Plaza, NBCUniversal, and Global Security Operations
* Collaborate with Supervisor to support Employee Registration office and responsibilities assigned and assist with special projects (as necessary)
* Monitor the performance of contract security personnel that support Guest Reception
* Collaborate with Supervisor to support the Executive Security reception desk (as necessary)
* Process workflow reports as necessary
* Manage critical access lists
* Evaluate-cross train contract security personnel assigned to Guest Reception
* Oversee the check-in process for large groups and VIP visitors for executive office, studio tours, and meetings
* Oversee the organization and cleanliness of the office and workstations
* Follow all processes and protocols set forth by management at all times
* Make prompt notifications to appropriate team members during unusual situations or emergencies. Handle all situations in an attentive, calm, and controlled manner
* Partner with organizations outside of Global Security to generate reports, update access control, admit guests, etc.
* Actively take part in training programs as directed
* Professional, friendly, effective, and efficient

  

**Qualifications**  

What You Must Have:

* 3+ years of experience in Guest Reception, Hospitality, Customer Service, or Security (or similar field)
* Experience issuing guest and employee credentials
* Proficient using MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and web applications
* Ability to maintain a corporate presence, professional demeanor, and positive attitude while assisting employees and their guests
* Available and willing to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and holidays


What Would Make You a Stand-out:

* 64+ College Credits or Military Experience (honorable discharge) Active Duty/Reservist (preferred but not required)
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment
* Ability to maintain composure in fast-paced surroundings
* Ability to multitask and prioritize
* Ability to successfully adapt to changes in the work environment
* Ability to work well on a team, independently, and with divisions external to the Security organization (e.g., Human Resources, Legal, EHS, etc.)


Additional Information:

* Required On-Site: This position is required to be performed full-time from an NBCUniversal-designated worksite.
* This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website. Salary range: $23.00 - $27.00/hour

  

**Additional Information**  

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision.


NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**Executive Assistant**
-----------------------



Named one of WorkLife's 50 Best Places to Work and one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies, Whalar Group is a global creator company on a mission to liberate the creative voice.



Creators are at the heart of everything we do! We are a curious, diverse team of 300 individuals around the world who are passionate about the Creator Economy. Our proximity, understanding, and trust of creators evolved into a first-of-its-kind creator ecosystem. Under Whalar Group, there are six companies: Whalar, a global creator agency; Whalar Talent, a full-service, 360° creator and talent management company; Foam, a suite of AI tools, templates, and services; Moby Ventures, a creator-centric venture studio; Umi Games, a groundbreaking gaming studio; and The Lighthouse, an IRL campus for creators and their teams.


**About the role:**
-------------------



You will work within our organization as a point person between 2 company executives and internal and external teams. It's a friendly but fast-paced atmosphere, with an amazing opportunity to learn about the creator economy from all angles. The ability to work to deadlines is critical. This role requires an innovative and ambitious multi-tasker who can come to the table with ideas and also work independently across multiple projects. You are an enthusiastic team player who has the ability to exercise good judgment in a variety of situations, with strong written and verbal communication. In this role, you will learn marketing, business development, and strategy hands on.


**Here's what you'll do day-to-day:**
-------------------------------------


* Provide direct support to the Presidents of Whalar US, the Chief of Staff, and the President of Measurement.
* Will work in the office 9am- 5pm, 4 days per week at our Hudson Yards office
* Manages an active calendar of appointments; completing expense reports, composing and preparing correspondence
* Manages travel plans, itineraries, and agendas, ensuring schedules are followed and respected
* Plan, coordinate, and facilitate various meetings, functions, and events including, team-building offsites and functions
* Prioritizes conflicting needs; handles matters expeditiously, and proactively
* Be a culture-contributor and help with culture initiatives, track, highlight, and celebrate important team cultural/career moments
* Will manage some day today office needs: helping book conference rooms, booking guests and welcoming clients, manage some in-office experiences/tasks
* **Adapt to a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment**

**Here's what we're looking for:**
----------------------------------


* **MUST be a great human and team player**(see if you fit in)!
* Minimum of 7+ years of strong industry experience supporting C-Level executives, preferably in a creative agency environment
* Familiarity with social media is a must
* Proficient in Google Suite (Docs, Spreadsheets, Slides), Calendar, and Drive
* Displays innovative thinking ("thinking on your feet")
* Works collaboratively ("team player") and builds relationships
* Displays professionalism and "grace under pressure".
* Has a sense of urgency and conveys a positive, "can-do" attitude
* Keen ability to prioritize workload and meet deadlines
* Detail-oriented and highly organized
* **In office; will be one of the connective tissues and key faces of Whalar**


The salary range for this role is $80k - $100k and serves as a general guideline reflecting the potential compensation for the role. The final salary offer will be determined based on a comprehensive evaluation of factors such as the candidate's experience, expertise, alignment with the position's requirements, and ultimately budget approvals.


**Our values:**
---------------



At Whalar, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) isn't just a statement, it's our collective strength. Our people are our superpower. A diverse team and inclusive leadership have shaped Whalar since our inception in 2016, fueling a constant evolution of growth. We champion a culture of respect and empathy, fostering a sense of belonging that transcends demographics. We hire individuals of all backgrounds and empower them to thrive, challenge stereotypes, and actively break societal barriers.


**The perks:**
--------------



Whalar provides flexible benefits and collaborative work environments/experiences, so employees can work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs.


* Medical, Dental, Vision
* 25 days of PTO + Sick days + Winter break
* 401k - 4% matching
* Monthly phone/internet reimbursement
* Professional development stipend
* New joiner Home office allowance
* Fertility benefits
* Up to 16 weeks of paid parental leave
* *Calm* App subscription (Add up to 4 dependents)
* Volunteer days
* Identity theft protection & Legal assistance
* Company Paid Life & Disability Insurance
* Extra Voluntary Life Insurance Policy
* Voluntary Hospital and Critical Illness Insurance
* Voluntary Pet insurance
* Employee Resource Groups


*Whalar provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Equal opportunity extends to all aspects of the employment relationship, including hiring, promotions, training, working conditions, compensation, and benefits.*

title: Field Sales Outreach Enrollment Specialist (NYC, Travel Required)
description:
Started in 2016, FreedomCare is a Healthcare company that is innovating and revolutionizing the way home care is delivered. We bring dignity and support to patients needing care in their homes and to the caregivers who care for them. We're the largest consumer-directed home care agency in NY State, and are continually expanding our areas of focus including operations in other states and tech-based innovations.



We pride ourselves on our values which drive the level of care that we deliver to our patients:


* Here For You (An attitude of service, empathy, and availability)
* Own It (Drive and ownership)
* Do the Right Thing (High integrity)
* Be Positive (Great attitude and a can-do positive approach to challenges)


Join our team and make a positive impact on the lives of others! We are looking for a Field Outreach Enrollment Specialist for our Pre-Care team.


***This is a field based position that will include fieldwork in the New York City area.***


**Department & Position Overview:**



The purpose of the role is to connect to community centers, leaders, to FreedomCare. The Field Community Outreach Specialist will be the face of FreedomCare and help us grow the company through community partnership. They would work with hospitals, health plans, healthcare associations, and directly with people in need.


**Every Day You Will:**


* Proactively create and nurture new relationships within NYC communities
* Assist in organizing and hosting NYC events CDPAP events to raise awareness and generate leads
* Build and maintain partnerships with local organizations, healthcare providers and community leaders to expand outreach efforts; utilize industry contacts to enhance company visibility
* Develop and implement tactics to effectively reach target demographics and communities
* Independently create reports to track and monitor lead development
* Effectively collaborate with internal team to ensure alignment of outreach efforts with company goals
* Generate qualified leads for CDPAP program, targeting 10-15 per week or 40 per month
* Track and report on outreach activities, including leads and partnerships established
* Act as a primary representative for the company, embodying professionalism in attire and communication style


**Ideal Candidate Will Possess:**


* Reliable transportation with the ability to travel throughout NYC territories
* Previous experience in community outreach, event planning or sales
* Proven track record of developing leads and meeting set targets
* Effective written and verbal communication skills with the ability to engage with diverse audiences
* A passion for providing a high level of customer service, including the ability to show empathy, active listening and patience.
* Ability to articulate case statuses through detailed notes on salesforce
* Computer proficiency required; strong typing skills and ability to leverage technology and resolve customer issues.


**Nice to Haves:**


* Two years of relevant experience in a similar position is preferred
* Bilingual in Spanish, or other languages desired
* Salesforce proficiency

  


**Why work at FreedomCare?**



We are here for you and committed to providing a best-in-class employee experience. We offer competitive compensation, medical benefits, retirement plans, wellness programs, fun company events and ongoing learning opportunities to grow your career.



This is a place where your voice matters, where we build great relationships, and your work has meaning and a tangible positive impact on others!

  


*At FreedomCare, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, citizenship or immigration status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.*

title: Front Desk Medical Assistant -Bilingual
description:
**Overview**

We are looking for a Medical Assistant with experience and a willingness to learn and grow within our workers’ compensation healthcare team. This position is crucial for maintaining the efficient operation of our medical office by providing excellent administrative support and patient care. At this time our top priority is finding someone who is bilingual in Spanish and English.

**Experience**

* **Required Experience**: Minimum of 3 years of experience in a medical office or healthcare setting, preferably in the role of front desk and medical assistant.

**Responsibilities**

* Explain treatment plans to patients and ensure they follow up with their physical therapy and chiropractic treatments.
* Review authorizations and medical charts related to physical therapy and chiropractic care.
* Schedule and reschedule appointments for all medical providers, including surgeries for the Podiatrist, and send reminders to patients.
* Process payments for treatments and medical forms.
* Answer phone calls and emails from patients and communicate with the office team and providers.
* Maintain an organized and smoothly running front desk and office.
* Confirm patients’ appointments and prepare charts for doctors.
* Welcome patients and provide Spanish translation when needed.
* Write disability letters for doctors.
* File and scan all prescriptions and superbills.

**Skills**

* **Communication Skills**: Ability to clearly explain treatment plans and communicate effectively with patients, medical staff, and insurance companies.
* **Organizational Skills**: Strong ability to manage appointments, maintain patient records, and keep the front desk area organized.
* **Customer Service**: Providing a welcoming and supportive environment for patients, addressing their needs and concerns promptly.
* **Attention to Detail**: Ensuring accuracy in scheduling, billing, and patient information.
* **Multitasking**: Handling multiple tasks efficiently, such as answering phones, scheduling appointments, and processing payments.
* **Technical Proficiency**: Familiarity with medical office software, electronic health records (Eclipse), and basic office equipment.
* **Problem-Solving**: Ability to address and resolve issues that may arise with patients or administrative tasks.
* **Confidentiality**: Maintaining patient privacy and handling sensitive information with discretion.
* **Language Skills**: Proficiency in Spanish
* **Adaptability**: Willingness to learn new skills and adapt to changes in a fast-paced medical environment.

**Key Traits**

* **Reliability**: Consistently dependable and punctual
* **Empathy**: Understanding and compassionate towards patients, making them feel comfortable and cared for.
* **Professionalism**: Maintaining a professional demeanor in all interactions with patients, staff, and external contacts.
* **Patience**: Able to handle stressful situations calmly and effectively.
* **Detail-Oriented**: Attentive to details to ensure accuracy in scheduling, billing, and patient records.
* **Adaptability**: Flexible and open to learning new skills and adapting to changes in the healthcare environment.
* **Strong Work Ethic**: Dedicated and hardworking, with a commitment to providing excellent service.
* **Communication**: Clear and effective in both verbal and written communication.
* **Team Player**: Collaborative and able to work well with others in a team setting.
* **Organized**: Efficient in managing multiple tasks and maintaining an orderly workspace.

**Certifications Preferred**

* Electronic Health Records Specialist Certification (CEHRS)
* Certified HIPAA Professional (CHP)
* Microsoft Office Specialist (MOS): Expert (Office 365 and Office 2019)

**Why Join Our Team**

* **Growth Opportunities**: We offer continuous learning and development opportunities to help you advance in your career.
* **Supportive Environment**: Join a team that values collaboration, support, and mutual respect.
* **Impactful Work**: Play a vital role in improving patient care and contributing to a positive healthcare experience.
* **Competitive Benefits**: We provide benefits packages, including 401K plans and paid time off.

description:
JOB TITLE: Sales Associate- FREEHOLD RACEWAY MALL

**Job description**

Become a part of The Inspiration Company Team! The Inspiration Company is interrupting the fashion industry with our gorgeous, one-of-a-kind, patented bracelets that are as powerful as they are beautiful. Our unique bracelets are engraved with messages that inspire change, encourage faith, and ignite passion in each of us to take responsibility for our daily experience and start creating a masterpiece of our daily lives. Our one-of-a-kind, stunning Earth Stone Bracelets were featured in US Weekly as one of the Top Summer Trends. We were also just featured on Good Morning America and in The Grammy Awards Swag Bag! The Freehold Raceway Mall is our 65th location nationwide!! It's an amazing opportunity! You are not going to want to miss it;).

**We are currently hiring for:**

* SALES ASSOCIATE

**PAY**: $18 an hour

**SUPPLEMENTAL**& Tips

**REQUIREMENTS** -

* SALES ASSOCIATE

Have a passion for Inspiration Company products and mission.

* Have a positive attitude and a desire to help others in need of inspiration.
* Demonstrate enthusiasm and eagerness to learn the fundamentals of all store roles, including but not limited to Customer Service, Visual Presentation, Inventory, and Bracelet Making.

* Be able to effectively communicate with customers.
* Physical requirements include the ability to twist, bend, squat, reach, and stand for extended periods of time.
* Ability to accomplish multiple tasks in a fast-paced work environment.
* Able to work effectively with others in a team-oriented environment and provide excellent customer service.

We are looking for dynamic individuals, who can help our customers find the perfect bracelet for whatever season of life they are going through. title: Mechanical and Electrical Assembly Technician
description:
Diamond Chemical is a leading provider of advanced chemical products and proprietary state-of-the-art dispensing and reporting systems for industrial and commercial applications. We are dedicated to delivering high-quality solutions that meet the specific needs of our clients. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a skilled and motivated Mechanical and Electrical Assembly Technician to join our team.

Job Overview:  
We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Mechanical and Electrical Assembly Technician to assist in the assembly, testing, and installation of our chemical dosing systems. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both mechanical and electrical assembly, with a focus on precision and quality.

Key Responsibilities:  
- Assemble, build, and install mechanical, electrical, and electronic components of chemical dosing systems.  
- Interpret and work from technical drawings, schematics, and assembly instructions.  
- Troubleshoot and resolve mechanical and electrical issues during the assembly process.  
- Collaborate with engineers and other team members to ensure systems are built to specifications and standards.  
- Given instruction, conduct quality control checks to ensure all components meet company and industry standards.  
- Assist in the setup and testing of completed systems to ensure functionality and safety.  
- Maintain a clean and organized workspace, adhering to all safety protocols.

- Have the capacity to learn the following: Wiring, soldering, and testing of electrical and electronic components.

- Assist in the collection, assembly and preparation of parts and systems for shipping

- Perform disassembly, cleaning and refurbishment of used systems to defined expectations

Qualifications:  
- High school diploma or equivalent; technical certification or associate degree in a related field is a plus.  
- Proven experience in mechanical and electrical work including use of common trades tools  
- Basic understanding of mechanical systems, electrical wiring, and electronic components.  
- Ability to read and interpret technical drawings and schematics.  
- Problem-solving skills and attention to detail.  
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  
- Good communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.  
- Commitment to safety and quality in all aspects of work.

- Must be able to bend, kneel, climb, reach, squat, stand, and walk

- Must be able to lift 50 lbs

- Must have a valid drivers license

- Willingness to travel and stay overnight if required

What We Offer:  
- Competitive salary  
- Opportunities for professional growth and development.  
- A dynamic and supportive work environment.  
- The chance to work with cutting-edge technology in a growing industry.

- Benefits package including: Major Medical and Dental insurance; 401(K), Life Insurance, Disability coverage, vacation and paid holidays

Diamond Chemical Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

* Day shift

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
**Job Title:** Direct Support Professional (DSP)  
**Location** : Lodi, NJ  
**Employment Type:** Full-Time  
**Salary:** Competitive, Based on Experience  
About Us:  
Felician IMPACT a day habilitation program, is dedicated to providing high-  
quality care and support to individuals with disabilities. We are committed to  
empowering our clients to live fulfilling, independent lives. We are seeking  
compassionate and motivated individuals to join our team as Direct Support  
Professionals (DSPs).  
Job Summary:  
As a Direct Support Professional, you will provide essential care, guidance,  
and support to individuals with developmental, physical, or intellectual  
disabilities. Your role will be to assist clients in achieving greater  
independence by helping them with daily living activities, supporting their  
goals, going out into the community and ensuring a safe and nurturing  
environment.  
Responsibilities:

* Support individuals in participating in social and recreational activities
* Accompany clients on community outings, and other activities.
* Teach and encourage life skills, including communication, budgeting,

and self-care.

* Monitor and document clients’ progress, behaviors, and needs.
* Work closely with other team members, to create and follow

individualized service plans.

* Assist in planning activities that are person centered.

Qualifications :

* High School Diploma or equivalent (required).
* Previous experience working with individuals with disabilities (preferred,

but not required).​• Compassion, patience, and a strong desire to make a positive impact.

* Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation (preferred).
* Must pass background checks and drug screening.

Benefits:

* Competitive salary and paid training.
* Health, dental, vision, pension.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* Supportive and inclusive work environment.

Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you are  
passionate about working with individuals with disabilities  
dsavastano@fsec.org.  
Felician IMPACT is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and  
are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

title: Delivery Driver – – ($20.00 per Hour ++ Commissions*)
description:
**Corporate Coffee Systems is hiring, and we want YOU to be part of our exceptional Logistics Team!**

Centrally located in Westbury, Long Island, **CCS** is a leading New York metropolitan breakroom supplier providing a world-class product line that brings that coffee-house feeling to our clients in the tri-state area. We specialize in a full line of name brand coffee and refreshment products, and business supplies that our clients can trust.

We are looking for a **Delivery/Route Driver** to support our clients throughout Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut. We offer an appealing balance of competitive wages, benefits and a safe, family-oriented work environment.

**Here’s what you’ll be doing:** 

· Solid experience in driving up to 16 foot box trucks

· A clean driving record (CDL is not necessary)

· Kindness Matters - Extend professional customer service and communicate clearly.

· Experience in navigating, driving and making deliveries in Manhattan are a plus.

**What Else?**

· **\\*This position offers additional earnings potential through commissions, with the added benefit that you’ll either receive overtime pay or commissions – whichever is higher – ensuring you’re always compensated at the best possible rate.** 

· Hourly Pay Rate of $20.00 per hour

· You'll need to be able to handle some heavy lifting (up to 60 pounds).

· **Start time at 6:30am until deliveries are completed.**

· We’ll even throw in some snazzy uniforms!

· This is a union position.

At Corporate Coffee Systems, we believe in inclusivity. Everyone is welcome here, no matter who you are or where you're from! We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

**So, are you ready to join a winning team?**

Apply now and let's *brew up* something great together. EOE. No Agencies or phone calls please.

title: Head of Miro Academy
description:
#### **About the Team**



The Scaled Customer Experience (SCE) team provides value at scale for all of our users and customers through well-crafted learning experiences, campaigns, and resources to ensure their success. We use digital, live, and on-demand methods to connect Miro customers to the best practices that will help them build the next big thing. Our team combines the best of automated, experiment-driven digital connection with innovative learning content that delivers both substance and delight directly to our users.


#### **About the Role**



We're looking for a facilitator and learning consultant to deliver best-in-class product training experiences, facilitate webinars and other large-audience scaled events expertly, and maintain positive relationships with our valued customers. The senior facilitator partners with the Manager of the Miro Academy and members of the team to craft and maintain a library of entertaining and educational content. The role will suit those best who love working cross-functionally, get joy from live training and responding to user questions, and those who get excited about novel approaches to crafting content.


#### **What you'll do**


* Set a clear vision for Miro Academy in concert with the SCE leadership team and drive execution of an ambitious roadmap that enables our users and drives behavior change at scale through on-demand, live and digital resources, focusing on adoption of Miro uses cases and education offering utilization growth QoQ
* Lead a team of instructional designers, customer-facing facilitators and contract staff to produce engaging content, deliver key learning experiences, and drive utilization of offerings across all Miro users, accounts and plans
* Craft and lead strategies for Academy expansion over the next year, including but not limited to partner, developer and creator training, badging and localization
* Own and run the Miro Academy platform as a product, overseeing content strategy, technical enhancements, offerings and releases, ensuring high CSAT and NPS across all programs, in alignment with product releases and messaging, and in coordination with internal teams from operations, IT, analytics, product and marketing
* Operationalize learning offerings into GTM motions within sales and customer success in partnership with the Digital Success team
* Increase the rate of resource creation and content quality through use of AI, process enhancements, and sophisticated content taste and editorial chops

#### **What you'll need**


* 5 years of people management experience leading instructional design, training or education content production teams. Managing people managers or team leads is a plus
* 6+ years building and delivering engaging customer-facing educational content in a variety of modalities in consultation with stakeholders and SMEs, ideally at SaaS or tech organizations
* Enthusiasm for both leading a team of instructional designers and rolling up your sleeves as an instructional designer yourself
* Experience setting and consistently meeting ambitious education program and production goals in a fast-paced, dynamic environment for both self and small teams
* Seasoned in scoping, distributing and tracking work progress across your team
* Highly proactive, analytical and product-driven approach to building and maintaining a customer-facing academy of resources
* Experience using data and assessments to evaluate and report on the performance of educational content and deep experiencing creating and presenting executive reports for VP+ audience

#### **What's in it for you**


* 401k matching + Competitive equity package
* Excellent Medical, Dental and Vision health benefits
* Fertility & Family Forming Benefits
* Flexible time off
* Lunch, snacks and drinks provided in the office
* Wellbeing benefit and WFH equipment allowance
* Annual learning and development allowance to grow your skills and career
* Up to $2,000 of charitable donation matches each year


*The reasonably estimated salary range is specific to New York and may not be applicable to other locations. The range for this role is $180k - $220k. Final compensation and total package components will be based on individual factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience.*

#### **About Miro**



Miro is a visual workspace for innovation that enables distributed teams of any size to build the next big thing. The platform's infinite canvas enables teams to lead engaging workshops and meetings, design products, brainstorm ideas, and more. Miro, co-headquartered in San Francisco and Amsterdam, serves more than 60M users worldwide, including 99% of the Fortune 100. Miro was founded in 2011 and currently has more than 1,800 employees in 12 hubs around the world.



We are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard, and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves every day. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you!



Check out more about life at Miro:


* Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/@lifeatmiro
* Blog: https://miro.com/careers/life-at-miro/all/
* Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mirohq/


At Miro, we strive to create and foster an environment of belonging and collaboration across cultural differences. Miro's mission — *Empower teams to create the next big thing* — is how we think about our product, people, and culture. We believe that creating big things requires diverse and inclusive teams. *Diversity* invites all talent with different demography, identities and styles *to step in*, and *inclusion* invites them to step *closer together.* Every day, we are working to build a more diverse Miro, cultivate a sense of belonging for future and current Mironeers around the world, and foster an environment where everyone can collaborate and embrace differences.


**Miro handles and uses personal data of job applicants in line with its** **Recruitment Privacy Policy** **found** **here****.**

title: Delivery Driver Helper - $17/hr (DL is must)
description:
WildCat LLC, a Delivery Service Partner, exemplifies safety and teamwork in logistics. By prioritizing safety and fostering a collaborative culture, we create an exceptional work environment.

We have a new opening for a professional Driver Helper to assist our Driver Associates with delivering in prestigious city routes serving the Edison areas. We always operate with professionalism and courtesy, providing excellent service to our delivery customers.

As a Driver Helper, you’ll ride along with a Package Delivery Driver in our famous Smiley trucks and help get packages exactly where they need to be. This job involves getting in and out of the truck, making deliveries and greeting customers. Helpers will not be driving the vehicles at any time. This is a lot of work but also a lot of fun!

What You’ll Do as a Driver Helper:

* Work 3-4 days per week with shifts available seven days a week
* Interact with customers and the public in a professional and positive manner.
* Help deliver 250 or more packages ranging from envelopes to boxes up to 50lbs.

· Load and offload packages up to 50lbs from the delivery van to the front door

· Scheduled 10 hours shifts with breaks and lunch included.

Benefits

* Paid vacation
* Medical, Dental and Vision benefits!
* Uniforms provided!
* Training and advancement opportunities!

Requirements:

* At least 21 years old
* Able to lift packages weighing up to 50 lbs. and move bundles weighing 70 lbs.
* Works at least one weekend per week (everyone must work either Saturday or Sunday)
* Proficient with a smartphone
* Delivery Helper will assist Driver in delivering packages

What You’ll Do as a Driver Helper

As a Driver Helper, you’ll ride along in a DOT regulated Step Van, stay active, work independently, and be part of a motivated team that safely delivers packages to customers in your community.

* Work 3-4 days per week and up to 8 -10 hours per day with shifts available seven days a week
* Full-Time positions are available
* Interact with customers and the public in a professional and positive manner
* Assist the Delivery Driver to safely load and deliver packages ranging from 50lbs (team lift)
* Delivery Helpers may qualify in the future to work as Delivery Drivers

title: Science Teacher - Leave Coverage
description:
Reports To: Head of Science
Status: 2-month leave coverage
Work Schedule: 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.  

Job Overview:
St. Bernard’s School is a K-9 independent boys’ school founded in 1904. The school, located on the Upper East Side, serves a diverse community of approximately 380 students and 100 employees.

St. Bernard’s offers young boys of diverse backgrounds an exceptionally thorough, rigorous, and enjoyable introduction to learning and community life. We wish to inspire boys to value hard work and fair play, to develop confidence, consideration for others, and a sense of citizenship, and to have fun while doing these things. We believe that young boys enjoy many benefits from an elementary school designed just for them.  

We are seeking a Science teacher for coverage for the months of November and December. The science teacher should have a firm understanding of cellular biology (structure and function, growth and division, and DNA structure and replication) for the 9th-grade curriculum. In the 4th grade, they will need to teach students about ecosystems and biodiversity. The 5th-grade curriculum will cover climate change and its impact on different communities/ecosystems throughout the world. Finally, the teacher will need to guide 4th and 5th students through a portion of their science fair projects using secondary data. This Science teacher will be expected to coordinate with the current Science teacher and Head of Science about the student curriculum and grades. The teacher will have the opportunity to provide an effective learning environment through planning, organizing, developing, and assessing a comprehensive instructional Science curriculum for grades IV, V, and IX. This position will include teaching five sections of Science.  

Responsibilities:* Communicate effectively with homeroom teachers and parents regarding student progress, academic performance, and emotional well-being.
* Assign, grade, and return homework, tests, and lab assignments promptly.
* Maintain and update a Google Classroom to facilitate student learning and communication.
* Provide individualized support to students during prep periods to help them succeed.
* Foster a positive and inclusive classroom environment that promotes learning and collaboration.
* Implement inquiry-based learning approaches to engage students and develop critical thinking skills.
* Guide and supervise students during lab work, ensuring their safety and understanding of scientific concepts.
* Actively participate in department meetings and contribute to maintaining a well-organized and functional science lab.
* Ability and willingness to cover classes and other supervisory periods when needed.
* Participate in the life of the school community through activities such as supervising a student lunch table, attending school assemblies, etc.
* Other duties as assigned by the Head of School

  

Qualifications:* Bachelor's degree in Science or a related field
* A student-centered, collegial, passionate, and innovative approach to teaching and learning
* Ability to work independently and collaborate in teams with a wide range of individuals.
* Commitment to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and diverse learning environment.
* For all St. Bernard’s positions, the ability to play the piano is always considered a plus (music is a part of everyone’s day).

  

Applicants who are interested should email cover letter and resume as a pdf to humanresources@stbernards.org  

St. Bernard’s welcomes and seeks a diverse community of students, faculty, staff, and parents. We're an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.  

In compliance with NYC’s Pay Transparency Act, the annual base salary range for this position is $75,000 to $115,000 ($6,250 to $9,583 per month). St. Bernard’s School considers factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate’s work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and organizational considerations when extending an offer.

title: Automotive Sales Consultant
description:
**McGuire Cadillac, family-owned for over 70 years,** is seeking applicants that are friendly, self-motivated and goal-oriented to join our professional team of Sales Consultants. This is an outstanding opportunity with excellent income potential. Experience preferred but not necessary.

We have a loyal customer base with a strong repeat and referral business. If you are friendly, and enjoy providing exceptional customer service, we would like to meet you! We provide excellent compensation and benefits as well as a friendly, professional work environment.

**No experience is necessary** - Training is provided. If you are self-motivated with a strong desire to succeed, we are willing to invest in your success*.*

**Salary plus commission**

**Job Description:**

The Sales Consultant is responsible for working with clients to develop relationships, identify vehicle preferences and select the appropriate model while ensuring each customer has a premium buying experience. Must be self-motivated with a willingness to continuously prospect and follow up with all potential and existing customers.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Greet customers and identify the type of vehicle in inventory that meets their needs

title: Data Entry Technician
description:
Jet-Care® is a laboratory specializing in providing oil, fuel, hydraulic fluid and debris analysis services to international oil companies, engine manufacturers and operators of aircraft, ships and industrial machines for over 35 years.

We are looking for a candidate with excellent data entry skills, a willingness to learn and someone who is able to think independently to join our team of data entry specialists. We are seeking an individual who is looking for a long-term stable position with a steady company and welcomes a dynamic challenging workload.

**Main Job Duties:**

* Prepare source data for computer entry by compiling and sorting information
* Process customer and equipment source documents (labels) by reviewing data for deficiencies
* Resolve discrepancies by using standard procedures or quarantining incomplete documents for further investigation
* Enter customer and equipment data by inputting alphabetic and numeric information on keyboard or optical scanner according to screen format
* Maintain data entry requirements by following data program techniques and procedures
* Verify entered customer and equipment data by reviewing, correcting, deleting, or reentering data
* Maintain operations by following policies and procedures; reporting needed changes
* Maintain customer confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential
* Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related tasks as needed

**Other Job Duties:**

* Sort and scan customer and equipment documentation
* Scan, Catalogue and file documentation electronically on the internal network

**Skills/Qualifications**: Organization, Typing, Data Entry Skills, Attention to Detail, Confidentiality, Thoroughness, Decision Making, Independence, Analyzing Information, Ability to Work Under Pressure, Results Driven, Energetic.

**Education and Experience** High school diploma. Formal computer training an advantage. Proficient in relevant computer applications such as MS Office. Accurate keyboard skills and proven ability to enter data at the required speed. Knowledge of correct spelling, grammar and punctuation. Knowledge of clerical and administrative procedures.

This is a full-time position; hours are 9:30 - 6:00. We provide complete training and a lucrative benefits package upon completion of the probationary period.

References required, mandatory pre-employment drug/alcohol testing and background check.

Jet-Care is an equal opportunity employer. Veterans welcome.

COVID-19 vaccination is required.

title: Safety and Quality Assurance Manager
description:
Diamond Chemical Company, a leader in manufacturing high-quality chemical products, is seeking a Safety and Quality Assurance Manager to join our dynamic team. We are committed to excellence in our processes and to ensuring the highest safety standards across our operations.

Job Overview:

The Safety and Quality Assurance Manager will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining safety programs, quality control procedures, and ensuring compliance with local, state, and federal regulations. This role will work closely with production and leadership teams to foster a culture of safety and continuous improvement.

Key Responsibilities:

* Oversee and manage safety programs and policies, ensuring compliance with OSHA, EPA, and other regulatory agencies.
* Develop, implement, and maintain quality assurance programs to ensure all products meet or exceed industry standards and customer expectations.
* Conduct regular safety audits, training sessions, and quality assessments.
* Collaborate with production teams to ensure adherence to safety protocols and quality controls.
* Investigate incidents, accidents, and quality issues, identifying root causes and recommending corrective actions.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry regulations, safety trends, and best practices.
* Lead continuous improvement initiatives in safety and quality processes.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in Occupational Safety, Environmental Science, Chemistry, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in safety management and/or quality assurance within a manufacturing environment, preferably in the chemical industry.
* Strong knowledge of OSHA, EPA, and industry-related quality standards.
* Proven leadership and team management experience.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Why Join Diamond Chemical Company?

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work in a dynamic and growing company.
* Commitment to employee safety and professional development.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their resume and cover letter to payroll@diamondchem.com. Please include “Safety and Quality Assurance Manager Application” in the subject line.

This ad highlights the key aspects of the job while emphasizing the company’s commitment to safety and quality.

Job Type: Full-time

Experience:

Ability to Commute:

* East Rutherford, NJ 07073 (Preferred)
