title: Part-Time Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP)
description:
Job Description:

Noir Well Mobile Adult Health NP, PC is seeking an experienced compassionate, community quality care focused Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) to join our team part-time in Brooklyn, NY. This role offers the opportunity to provide high-quality mental health services to a diverse community, focusing on the diagnosis, treatment, and management of psychiatric conditions. Bilingual in Spanish is preferred, as we serve a multilingual population.

Key Responsibilities:

- Conduct thorough mental health assessments, including patient interviews, evaluations, and diagnostic tests.

- Develop and implement individualized treatment plans for patients with a variety of psychiatric disorders, such as anxiety, depression, and mood disorders.

- Prescribe and manage psychiatric medications, ensuring appropriate follow-up and monitoring.

- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals, including primary care providers and therapists, to ensure comprehensive, integrated care.

- Provide patient education and counseling on mental health conditions, treatment options, and coping strategies.

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date electronic medical records (EMR) in compliance with healthcare regulations.

- Participate in ongoing quality improvement initiatives and stay current with best practices in psychiatric care.

- Engage in community outreach events to promote wellness and preventive care within underserved populations.

Qualifications:

- Current and valid Psychiatric-Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) license in New York.

- Board certification as a PMHNP.

- A minimum of 2 years of experience working in mental health, including experience with psychiatric evaluations and medication management.

- Bilingual in Spanish is preferred.

- Strong clinical judgment and the ability to work independently in a community healthcare setting.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a focus on providing compassionate, patient-centered care.

- Familiarity with electronic health records (EHR) systems.

- Experience treating HIV/AIDS and other infectious diseases is a plus

About Noir Well Mobile Adult Health:

We are committed to providing equal, high-quality care for all individuals, regardless of race, creed, color, gender identity, or any other characteristic. Our mission is to eliminate disparities in healthcare and ensure everyone receives the care they deserve.

---

title: Dentist Anesthesiologist (DA) -NY & NJ
description:
Aspire Anesthesia is a growing mobile dental anesthesia provider serving the Metropolitan New York area (New York and New Jersey). We provide anesthesia services at various private dental offices and surgical centers, and our patient population primarily ranges in age from teenagers up through geriatrics. We are Fee-For-Service (FFS), non-insurance-based practice with 100% collections.

We are looking for a full-time Dentist Anesthesiologist (DA) to join our dynamic and expanding team.

The right candidate will be a highly motivated, energetic, and passionate team player who will aid in the growth of the business. Additionally, the candidate should have strong clinical abilities, communication, and interpersonal skills. New or recent graduates are welcomed to apply.

We offer:

· 50% of collection; rate is commensurate with experience. We have 100% collection.

· Typically, 1 to 2 patients per day; 3 to 6+ hours.

· Common surgical procedures: All-on-X implant surgeries and full mouth oral rehabilitations.

· Flexible hours with typical: 8AM start to 3:00PM (for a single case).

· The opportunity for growth and advancement within the company.

· You can bring your own, or we can help supply you with equipment, patient scheduling services, etc. We can also help with state credentialing, obtaining a DEA number and getting insurance coverage.

We provide administrative services such as scheduling, billing, medical history and patients’ optimization, as well as other administrative tasks so that the DA can focus on excellent clinical anesthesia service for our dentists and patients.

Responsibilities and Requirements include:

* Perform pre-operative assessments and provide communication to patients regarding options.
* Required credentials such as DDS or DMD or MD degree, followed by completion of an approved residency training in Dental Anesthesiology or Medical Anesthesiology
* Preferred Board Certification, Board Eligibility or being in the process of certification
* Maintenance of CE classes, board certifications and BLS, ACLS and PALS requirements in good standing.
* Ability to obtain and maintain Professional malpractice insurance.
* Ideal candidate to have excellent interpersonal skills, possess high moral/ethical standards and have good clinical skills.
* Collaborate with surgeons, dentists and patients to optimize, develop and implement anesthesia plans.
* Maintain accurate documentation of anesthesia administration, patient responses and any events.
* Stay up to date with evident based research in anesthesia techniques, medications and equipment.

Our members are as diverse as the patients we serve. Building special connections with our patients throughout their dental journey with us is one of the many benefits of this position. We are obsessed with our patients, diverse offices we serve, and simply love what we do. To apply, kindly forward a CV/Resume with cover memo via email to: office@aspireanesthesia.com

title: Compliance Manager (Personnel/Labor Relations Associate), HR Administration/Harlem
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals:**

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

**Job Description**

**URPOSE OF POSITION:**

The HR Compliance Manager, Personnel/Labor Relations Associate under the direction of the HR Director, will oversee and manage the planning, organizing controlling and coordinating the day to day operation of the Human Resources Records Management/Compliance Unit, including the management and preparation for all regulatory required surveys.

**SUMMARY OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Coordination and review of competency / evaluation packages
* Collaboration with department leadership to ensure compliance with Joint Commission, CMS & other Regulatory HR standards.
* Constant communication with employees, managers and HR Team requests and escalation of failure to comply issues as appropriate. Provide guidance and support to HR staff and departmental managers on compliance-related matters, including employee relations, recruitment, hiring, and termination processes
* Responsible for ensuring compliance in the HR records management unit and maintaining all compliance tasks in accordance with federal, state and company requirements.
* Monitor applicable human resource related requirements to ensure legal compliance.
* Responsible for departmental reporting, data integrity and accuracy of HR systems
* Run monthly quality assurance reports from PeopleSoft and update employee profiles including scanning to OnBase.
* In conjunction with HR Director will assist with the development and implementation of HR compliance strategies, policies, and procedures in alignment with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards
* Conduct regular audits and assessments to evaluate the effectiveness of HR compliance programs and identify areas for improvement
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to address compliance issues, investigations, and employee evaluation grievances
* In conjunction with the HR Director will develop and deliver compliance training programs for employees and managers to promote awareness and understanding of HR policies and procedures
* Participate in regulatory inspections, audits, and reviews, and complete responses as needed.
* Participate in Facility and Systemwide Emergency Management as needed
* Other projects and duties as assigned

**Minimum Qualifications:**

1. A Baccalaureate Degree in a relevant field from an accredited college or university; and,  
2. Three year experience in one or more of the following: classification and salary administration, employment and testing, training and counseling, employee relations, labor relations and personnel administration, research; or,  
3. Graduation from a senior high school and five years of satisfactory experience in personnel administration, of which at least four years must have been at a responsible level of personnel administration, labor relations, employee relations; or,  
4. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Housekeeping Room Attendant
description:
HOUSEKEEPING ROOM ATTENDANT  
Hilton Pearl River  
500 Veterans Memorial Drive  
Pearl River, NY 10965  
www.hiltonpearlriver.com

**Hiring Rate: $15.75 - $16.00/hr**

Hilton Pearl River, a full-service luxury hotel located 25 minutes from New York City in Rockland County (NY) and bordering Bergen County (NJ), is seeking a well organized and energetic individual to join our exceptional team as full time Housekeeping Room Attendant.

Hilton Pearl River remains an innovative forward-thinking hospitality leader by offering best-in-class products, services, and amenities to ensure every guest feels cared for, valued, and respected. A Room Attendant with Hilton Pearl River is responsible for cleaning a minimum of 15 guestrooms a day while following all guestroom protocols that ensure a high standard of cleanliness and quality of the Hotel.

Specific Job Knowledge, Skill, and Ability

* Sign out for room keys, restock housekeeping cart with supplies needed to complete room assignment
* Clean and scrub bathtub, toilet, sink, walls, tiles, counter and floor surfaces with germicidal cleaner. Use sponges/brushes. Clean mirrors with glass cleaner. This task requires extending hand over head, bending and stooping
* Strip and make beds, change linens, lift bedspreads, which weigh a maximum of 35 lbs
* Replenish amenities, towels, and supplies in guestrooms
* Thoroughly dust/polish all furniture, wall hangings, drawers, window ledges, shelves, phones, lampshades, headboards, and HVAC vents
* Empty trash and vacuum entire room
* Visually inspect rooms for cleanliness and appearance and signify completion of room according to Hilton standards
* Ability to push and or pull equipment weighing up to 75 lbs
* Ability to scrub and scour surfaces, extending arm over head to perform cleaning tasks
* Ability to communicate effectively with guests as well as other team members
* Ability to follow instructions, directions, and meet deadlines, including thorough cleaning of the minimum number of rooms as specified
* Basic ability to comprehend English language sufficient to understand information such as labels and instructions and basic guest request qualified

Candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Hilton Pearl River reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity at its sole discretion.

Shift

* Must be able to work all weekends/weekdays/nights/holidays – must be able to work a flexible schedule based on hotel needs

Education

* High School graduate or equivalent required

Experience

* 0-1 year experience in hospitality or residential living industry preferred

Compensation and Benefits

* Hilton Team-Member Travel Program benefits

Please send ONLY resumes' and cover letters. Only those candidates qualified will be contacted. Must be able to work in the United States as we are an E-Verify employer.

About the Hilton Pearl River

Hilton Pearl River is a third-generation family-owned and operated Hilton franchise built in 1988. The hotel is located on 17 wooded acres in the scenic Hudson River Valley, just 25 minutes from New York City, and has built and maintained a reputation for consistently exceptional service. The hotel consistently is awarded TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence award and has been ranked #1 in "Overall Service" of all Hiltons in New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut for nine of ten consecutive years. The property features 150 newly renovated guest rooms, restaurant, bar, and recreation facilities, as well as over 20,000 square feet of unique and flexible meeting and event space, and an experienced team of professionals committed to excellence.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer - M/F/H/D/V/T

Company is committed to providing equal employment opportunity and strictly prohibits all forms of unlawful harassment and discrimination based upon race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age over 40, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status, mental or physical disability, medical condition or any other basis protected by law

Company prefers to recruit candidates directly, rather than through a third-party recruiter or agency. title: Bookkeeper/Administrative Assistant
description:
Are you excited by the challenge of balancing accounts to the penny? Are you someone who finds satisfaction in organizing financial data and creating efficient systems? Are you detail-oriented to the point where you can't walk past a stray paperclip without picking it up? Are you comfortable asking questions and seeking clarification to ensure 100% accuracy in your work?

Looking for a role where your meticulous nature and love for administrative processes are valued? Then we may be looking for you.

**Who We Are** 

Scahill Law Group P.C. is a prominent Insurance Defense firm in Bethpage, NY. With over 35 years of multi-faceted legal experience, we specialize in general liability defense for insurance carriers and self-insureds. Our work includes automobile, premises liability claims, labor lawsuits, and complex insurance coverage issues. We're committed to achieving successful results and meeting our clients' needs.

**We Believe** 

* Respect is fundamental - for our clients, opposing counsel, and the due process of law.
* Communication, accessibility, and accountability are critically important in our practice.
* Attention to detail is crucial in both legal and financial matters.
* Asking questions and seeking clarification lead to better outcomes.
* In providing opportunities for growth and development within the firm.
* That reliability and accuracy are integral to our success.

**What You Will Do** 

- Process payments, invoices, income, and receipts using QuickBooks and other systems

- Manage accounts receivable, including applying payments for about 2000 invoices monthly

- Handle accounts payable, ensuring timely payments to vendors

- Verify accuracy of business and billing accounts, including court receipts and flat fee payments

- Input attorney mileage, travel time, and expenses

- Process court fees, ensuring they're correctly entered in the billing system

- Assist Billing Manager with financial and billing reporting for accountants and management

- Support the Accounting Director with various administrative tasks

**What You Will Accomplish** 

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records for the firm

- Ensure timely payment of invoices and processing of receipts

- Contribute to the firm's financial health through meticulous bookkeeping

- Develop and implement efficient systems for repetitive financial tasks

- Support the smooth operation of the firm's financial processes

**You are the Ideal Candidate If You Are** 

- Extremely detail-oriented, with a natural inclination for accuracy and order

- Comfortable with repetitive tasks and find satisfaction in solving financial "puzzles"

- Proactive in asking questions and seeking clarification when needed

- Self-motivated and able to work independently once trained

- Capable of maintaining multiple checking systems to verify information

- Genuinely interested in financial details and processes

- Driven by the potential for growth into more complex financial roles

**Basic Requirements** 

- Prior experience in accounts receivable, accounts payable, or collections

- Understanding of basic bookkeeping principles, including debits and credits

- Proficiency in QuickBooks and Excel preferred

- Familiarity with categorizing taxable and non-taxable items preferred

- Strong problem-solving skills, especially in reconciling financial discrepancies

- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

- Ability to manage time effectively and meet deadlines

- Willingness to work full-time (35 hours per week) in our Bethpage office

**Why You'll Love Working With Us** 

- Competitive pay range: $25 to $38 per hour DOE

- Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, and 401(k)

- Paid Time Off

- Professional growth opportunities in a respected law firm

- Hands-off management style that values your independence and initiative

- Professional yet collaborative work environment, exemplified through our weekly happy hours, office lunches, holiday celebrations, summer events, and team outings such as an evening at TopGolf like the Scanning Team just enjoyed.

If you're excited about this opportunity and believe you're the detail-oriented professional we're looking for, we'd love to hear from you! Please submit your application today.

Scahill Law Group P.C. is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: NJ State Certified EMT
description:
**We are looking for EMTs with NJ state certifications!** 

**Sign on Bonus for New Hires! Full Time - $3,500 / Part Time - $1,750 / Per Diem - $1000**

**Pay Scale:**

* Starting at $21.50 per hour
* Rates differ based on experience
* Weekend differential

**Hours Available:**

* Morning, Mid and Night shifts
* FT and PT
* 12 hr shifts

**Locations:**

* New Jersey - Lakewood (Home office), Pennsauken, Edison
* Delaware - Dover and Newark
* Maryland - Elkton

**Why We Are Worth The Application:**

At GEM Mobile Health, we strive to give the best customer service and care to every patient we transport. We are an ambulette transportation company that works with over 150+ facilities and hospitals throughout NJ, DE and MD. Not only do we do transports for doctors' appointments, check ups, facilities, discharges, but we also provide our facilities with the option to call in emergency calls when needed.

We realize that working in Healthcare and as a First Responder is difficult and we try our hardest to make sure that we listen to our employees to make a difference. We have an amazing team of Supervisors throughout our bases who are dedicated to helping others.

**What You Will Be Doing:**

The EMT will be working with another EMT or EMR on our BLS truck. You will be responsible for ensuring the client is safe, secure, comfortable and arrives at their destination per the guidelines with State and Federal statutes and regulations. You will be in constant contact with our dispatch team who will assign calls to you and your partner. If any issues arise, you must have clear communication with your supervisor(s), dispatch, partner and accurate charting.

**Responsibilities:**

* Pre and post hospital basic and life support treatment.
* Operates all vehicles safely and professionally in compliance with all laws and regulations.
* Accurately documents all patient information, vitals, facility information, etc.
* Maintains the cleanliness of the vehicles and troubleshooting all equipment and/or supplies to ensure there are enough necessary items available.
* Ensures all certifications are kept up to date and renewed before the expiration date.

**Requirements:**

* NREMT and/or NJ/NY/PA EMT Certification (Must be valid)
* Valid CPR card
* If an EMT driver, min of 18 years of age and not on a probation license
* Valid clean driver’s license from the USA
* Clear Criminal History Check
* Willing to submit a Pre-Employment Screening (Drug screen, PPD and physical)
* Completing a Defensive Driving course (If driving)
* Completing Fingerprinting
* Ability to lift, bend, twist and crouch up to 150lbs

**The Experience We Prefer:**

* Customer service background
* Excellent communication skills
* Patient care experience
* Charting/EPRO knowledge

**Bonus Opportunities:**

* Start gaining your PTO the 1st day you start working with us!

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Data Analyst
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Research (Laboratory/Non-Laboratory)
  

**Department** The Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies
  

**Overview**
The Rutgers Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies (formerly Rutgers Center for Tobacco Studies) is undergoing dynamic and transformative growth. The Rutgers Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies is one of the nation’s leading tobacco focused research centers and its faculty have received over $50 million in extramural funding over the past two decades. The Institute’s efforts are focused on their mission of reducing and ultimately eliminating, tobacco-related morbidity and mortality.  

  

Five Centers or Programs currently operate at the Institute including a Tobacco Center for Regulatory Science, the Center of Excellence for Rapid Surveillance of Tobacco, the Tobacco Dependence Program, a Tobacco Industry Marketing Program, and a Tobacco Control Law & Policy Resource Center.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers is seeking a Data Analyst for the Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies, located in New Brunswick, NJ. Under the direction of the leadership of the Office of Survey Methods and Data Analysis (SMDA), the Data Analyst will support the scientific work of investigators at the Rutgers Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies (INTS) by implementing data analysis protocols for research projects. The ideal candidate will have expertise in analyzing complex survey data and a background working with national health surveys, such as the National Health Interview Survey (NHIS), the Tobacco Use Supplement to the Current Population Survey (TUS-CPS) and similar surveillance systems.  

  

Duties include:  

* Conduct statistical analyses to identify trends and patterns of tobacco use and related behaviors.

  

* Under supervision of the Associate Director/ Chief of SMDA, select appropriate methods to analyze and interpret complex survey data from national health surveys.

  

* Create data visualizations to present findings in conference presentation, journal articles, and to other stakeholders.

  

* Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous data management practices.

  

* Develop codebooks based on INTS data in accordance with established practices at INTS.
  


  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week** 37.50
  

**Daily Work Shift** Day
  

**Work Arrangement**
  

**FLSA** Exempt
  

**Grade** 26S
  

**Position Salary**
  

**Annual Minimum Salary** 73161.00
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 87905.00
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 104450.00
  

**Standard Hours** 37.50
  

**Union Description** HPAE 5094
  

**Payroll Designation** PeopleSoft
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview**.  

  

**Seniority Unit**
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility** ABP
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**  

  

* Master’s Degree in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Public Health, or related sciences plus one (1) year related experience analyzing complex survey data.

  

* Must have a high level of computer literacy including Microsoft Office Suite and data querying tools.

  

* Intermediate or greater proficiency with at least one statistical package, preferably R (R, SAS, STATA, etc.).

  

* Experience analyzing cross sectional and longitudinal survey data, working with national and state health surveys, and using generalized linear models and related methods.

  

* Experience using mixed effects models to analyze clustered data preferred, but not required. Familiarity with tobacco use epidemiology and related public health issues.

  

* Ability to learn and integrate other related computer applications into existing operations.

  

* Must have excellent project management, time management, communication, interpersonal, decision making, analytic, and reporting skills.

  

* Must be able to work with a wide range of individuals with diverse backgrounds and perspectives on data usage including faculty, staff, and senior administrators, as well as individuals at other institutions and government offices.
  


  

**Preferred Qualifications**

title: Mental Health Specialist II - Part Time - 4p - 12:30a - Multiple Vacancies
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Mental Health Specialist II - Part Time - 4p - 12:30a - Multiple Vacancies
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Healthcare - Medical and Patient Services
  

**Department** UBHC NJ Hopeline
  

**Overview**
Rutgers University Behavioral Health Care (UBHC), established in 1971, offers a full continuum of evidence based behavioral health and addiction services for children, adolescents, adults, and seniors throughout New Jersey. UBHC’s 1,060 experienced behavioral health professionals and support staff are dedicated to treatment, prevention, and education. UBHC, one of the largest providers of behavioral health care in the country, has a budget of $260 million and has 15 sites throughout New Jersey. Services are readily accessible and include: inpatient, outpatient, partial hospitalization, screening, crisis stabilization, family/caregiver support, community outreach and case management, supportive housing, supported employment, prevention and consultation, employee assistance programs, and a licensed therapeutic school from preschool through high school. Specialty services include the New Jersey suicide prevention helpline and peer help lines for police, veterans, active military, teachers, mothers of special needs children and child protective service workers. In FY2016, UBHC treated 16,199 consumers, had 24,502 admissions, and touched the lives of 19,441 individual callers through peer support. In addition, UBHC is the primary mental health training resource for the New Jersey departments of Human Services, Children and Families, and Corrections, delivering 16,000 trainings each year.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Part Time Mental Health Specialist II for the 988 Lifeline Services Department within Rutgers University Behavioral Health Care.  

  

The primary purpose of the part time Mental Health Specialist II is to perform functions in support of the Unit’s mission providing streamlined, prompt, and “customer friendly” services to clients of the 988 Lifeline Services. Receives telephone, chat and/or text requests for service, undertakes assessment of the service need of the client and responds by offering support and appropriate referrals or disposition. Demonstrates competency in recognizing the unique needs of clients and applying relevant assessment and support skills with regard to a wide range of issues.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Models for clients’ good communication skills, recovery-oriented living skills, effective coping skills, and selfhelp strategies as observed by supervisor and as indicated by feedback from clients and team members.
* Assists clients in identifying their personal recovery goals, assists in setting objectives for each goal, and determines interventions to be used based on the client’s recovery/life goals.
* As part of the Call Center, actively participates in ensuring that all service requests are handled in an effective and “client friendly” manner.
* Assesses service requests/referrals and responds in accordance with prescribed procedures.
* Assesses client’s condition in order to make/authorize an appropriate disposition.

  

**Position Status** Part Time
  

**Hours Per Week** 16
  

**Daily Work Shift** Evening
  

**Work Arrangement**

description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Assistant Director, Data Core
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Research (Laboratory/Non-Laboratory)
  

**Department** The Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies
  

**Overview**
The Rutgers Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies (formerly Rutgers Center for Tobacco Studies) is undergoing dynamic and transformative growth. The Rutgers Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies is one of the nation’s leading tobacco focused research centers and its faculty have received over $50 million in extramural funding over the past two decades. The Institute’s efforts are focused on their mission of reducing and ultimately eliminating, tobacco-related morbidity and mortality.  

  

Five Centers or Programs currently operate at the Institute including a Tobacco Center for Regulatory Science, the Center of Excellence for Rapid Surveillance of Tobacco, the Tobacco Dependence Program, a Tobacco Industry Marketing Program, and a Tobacco Control Law & Policy Resource Center.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers is seeking a Assistant Director, Data Core for the Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies, located in New Brunswick, NJ The Assistant Director will play a crucial role in ensuring the planning and operation of the Office of Survey Methods and Data Analysis (SMDA) and collaborating on tobacco research.  

  

This position is responsible for managing daily activities, supervising and guiding a team of data analysts, and making scientific contributions to research projects at INTS in the capacity of a methodologist. Additionally, the Assistant Director will contribute to efforts aimed at identifying, planning, and operationalizing initiatives geared towards enhancing the overall methodological environment and resources at INTS. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership skills, a robust background in survey methods and data analysis, and the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects efficiently.  

  

Duties include:* Oversee the day-to-day operations of the Office of Survey Methods and Data Analysis.
* Facilitate writing project scope and quotes, and invoicing.
* Supervise and mentor a team of data analysts.
* Contribute to development of survey methodology and/or data analysis tools, such as R packages, methods briefs, and brown-bags.
* Identify new opportunities for SMDA to support investigator

* Master’s degree in survey methodology, epidemiology, biostatistics, or a related field with at least two years supervisory experience or PhD with supervisory experience in a research lab.
* Must have experience applying generalized linear models and mixed effects modeling approaches to analyze cross-sectional and longitudinal survey data from simple and complex sampling designs; and creating summary tables and data visualizations.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex information to investigators from different academic fields (e.g. public health, psychology, medicine).
* Familiarity with academic research processes, including study design, data collection, and publication.
* Proficiency in statistical software, preferably R. Ability to learn and integrate other related computer applications into existing operations.

Duties include formulating evaluations, developing and implementing treatment plans, conducting individual, group, and family therapy and providing case management functions.

**Department** SN-Advanced Nursing Practice

* Teaching experience preferred
  


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
Current RN/NJ Nursing License (as appropriate)
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
  

**Overview**
Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) of Rutgers University is a national academic health leader that is shaping the future of human health through pioneering medical research, culturally responsive, evidence-based patient care, teaching excellence and tireless health advocacy.
RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes. Our renowned faculty members are teachers, researchers, clinicians, and advocates. We are national leaders in the education and training of inter-professional healthcare teams, including nursing, medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, biomedical research, and allied health careers. As the premier public university of New Jersey, we are passionate about educating one of the most diverse health sciences student populations in the nation.  

  

**School Overview:**
As part of RBHS, Rutgers School of Nursing offers unique opportunities in education, research, and practice at a leading national research university. Innovative academic offerings include bachelor’s, master’s, post-master’s, DNP, and PhD programs.  

Rutgers University School of Nursing is dedicated to the pursuit of excellence in education, evidence-based research and health care delivery, and promotion of community health, and is currently ranked by US News and World Report as the top 5% of Best Nursing Schools for our BSN, MSN, and Doctor of Nursing Practice programs. Our DNP program is one of the largest in the United States, making Rutgers School of Nursing one of the most significant producers of DNP-prepared nurses in the world.  

**Rutgers School of Nursing is an actively anti-racist, anti-bias institution, committed to fostering a diverse, equitable and inclusive community. We seek faculty and staff who embrace this commitment. Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution.**
  

**Statement**
It is university policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all its employees and applicants for employment regardless of their race, creed, color, national origin, age, ancestry, nationality, marital or domestic partnership or civil union status, sex, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, disability status, liability for military service, protected veteran status, affectional or sexual orientation, atypical cellular or blood trait, genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing), or any other category protected by law. As an institution, we value diversity of background and opinion, and prohibit discrimination or harassment on the basis of any legally protected class in the areas of hiring, recruitment, promotion, transfer, demotion, training, compensation, pay, fringe benefits, layoff, termination or any other terms and conditions of employment. For additional information please see the Non-Discrimination Statement at the following web address: **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/non-discrimination-statement**

title: Lab Tech Assistant
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Lab Tech Assistant
  

**Posting Number** 24TM0395
  

**Department** Engn - Biomedical Engineering
  

**Overview**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is a leading national research university and the State of New Jersey’s preeminent, comprehensive public institution of higher education. As one of the largest employers in the State of New Jersey, Rutgers University is committed not only to the students and the State that we serve, but also to the faculty and staff who work on our campuses.  

  

  

For two consecutive years, Rutgers is ranked on Forbes’ list of America’s Best Large Employers. Rutgers holds #64 of 500 employers and is the #1 New Jersey employer on the publication’s 2023 list. Rutgers’ commitment to its employees includes maintaining and fostering a safe, diverse, and respectful workplace environment, creating employment opportunities for our nation’s military veterans, and ensuring accessibility and accommodation for individuals with disabilities.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Lab Tech Assistant for the Application of AI/ML methodology (deep generative modeling, DGM, using interpretable and identifiable representation learning algorithms) and a unique biological approach (platelet RNA transcriptomic/gene expression atlas of datasets derived from >2K+ patient and healthy donor specimens across the world) for the School of Engineering.  

  

Overall objective of the research is to uncover cross-functional roles of platelets (and parent megakaryocytes) in disease settings beyond their classical role in hemostasis and thrombosis (e.g. cancer, inflammation, infection).  

  

Among the key duties of the position are the following:* Research strategies include integrating multi-omics discovery with molecular, cellular and in vivo approaches.
* Immediate research goals are in mechanistic characterization as well as clinical laboratory validation of platelet multi-omic signatures derived from diverse patient cohorts.

title: Postdoctoral Associate - Oldenburg Lab
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Postdoctoral Associate - Oldenburg Lab
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Research (Laboratory/Non-Laboratory)
  

**Department** RWJ-CABM
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.  

  

Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Postdoctoral Associate for the Center for Advanced Biotechnology and Medicine (CABM) located on the Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences Campus in Piscataway, NJ.  

The Oldenburg Laboratory at CABM is seeking an outstanding Postdoc to join an exciting neuroscience project developing and utilizing new optical and molecular tools to study neural circuits. Under the direction of the Principal Investigator (PI), Dr. Ian Oldenburg, the Postdoctoral Associate will investigate of the role of neural activity in guiding and initiating motor actions.  

  

The Oldenburg Lab uses and develops advanced microscopy techniques, including multiphoton holographic optogenetics and calcium imaging in awake head fixed mice, to understand how groups of neurons work together to enact motor actions. Neural activity is complex and high dimensional with some activity patterns being associated with movements and others not. By using our novel techniques, that can drive precise patterns of activity distributed across many neurons, we can test different theories of the ‘population code’, gaining a causal understanding of how population activity drives actions.  

  

The postdoc will work with the PI to develop an independent project, that leverages the expertise of the lab and the skills and interests of the postdoc. In addition to multiphoton imaging and multiphoton optogenetics, projects may also involve animal training, electrical and optical engineering, electrophysiology, molecular biology, and/or computational analyses. The postdoc will have the opportunity to guide the research of an undergraduate research assistant, if desired.  

  

Mentorship is a core mission of the Oldenburg Lab. All members of the lab are expected to be helpful and supportive of each other. The PI will endeavor to do what he can to help each member succeed, both within the lab and when they eventually move on. As such, every member of the lab is encouraged to explore that which interests them and to share their specific expertise. In addition, the postdoc will have the opportunity to attend scientific conferences and learn appropriate scientific methods and procedures.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Carry out multiphoton optogenetic manipulation and imaging of neural activity in head-fixed rodents.
* Conduct rodent surgeries, rodent training, computational analyses, and other procedures necessary for the advancement of the project.
* Participate in the configuration and maintenance of laboratory instrumentation and equipment, including computers, necessary for conduct of the project.
* Prepare scientific manuscripts for publication, and contribute to the preparation of research grant and fellowship applications.
* Supervise and guide the research project of an undergraduate research assistant.
  


  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift** Day
  

**Work Arrangement**
This position requires a fully on-site work arrangement.

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Ph.D. in Neuroscience, Optical Physics/Engineering, Molecular Biology, or a related science is required.
* Ph.D. Candidates who meet requirements with All But Degree (ABD) will be considered.
* Prior experience and productivity in research must be demonstrated.
* Experience is required with modern analytical neuroscience techniques.

**Equipment Utilized**

description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Part-Time - Executive Director of the Center for Health Equity and Systems Research
  

**Department** College of Nursing
  

**Salary** Commensurate With Experience
  

**Posting Summary**
The Rutgers School of Nursing invites applications for the Part-Time position of Executive Director of the Center for Health Equity and Systems Research (CHESR). Salary and academic rank will be commensurate with scholarly achievements including funded research and publication record, as well as other relevant professional experience.  

  

Successful candidates will demonstrate the expertise and commitment to advancing nursing and interdisciplinary research as well as the launching and sustainment of a school of nursing research center
  

**Position Status** Part Time
  

**Posting Number** 24FA0733
  

**Posting Open Date**
  

**Posting Close Date**
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* PhD – area of expertise or focus of program of research that links to our educational mission and vision;
* Sustained record of scholarly publications
* A focused program of scholarship in an area complementary to nursing science;
* Skill at grant writing as evidence by securing extramural support for research;
* Experience in successfully launching and maintaining a research center

**Preferred Qualifications:*** Success securing highly competitive funding awards
* Experience with student advising / mentorship

  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
  

**Overview**
**Rutgers Health Overview:**  

New Jersey’s premier academic health center, Rutgers Health takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

Our elite and renowned faculty are teachers, health researchers and providers, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education and training in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers. An important mission of RBHS is to promote the careers of faculty, staff, and learners.
Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.  

**School Overview:**
  

The School of Nursing is one of eight schools that make up the Rutgers University, Rutgers Health. . As part of the Rutgers Health division, the School of Nursing offers unique opportunities in education, research, and practice at a leading national research university which is the state’s preeminent, comprehensive public institution of higher education.  

Innovative academic offerings include bachelor’s (BSN), master’s, post-master’s, Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) , and PhD programs that are preparing nurse leaders of today and tomorrow at campus locations in Newark, New Brunswick, and Blackwood, NJ. Our BSN, master’s and DNP programs are ranked by US News and World Report as being among the highly rated programs in the nation.  

As one of the nation’s largest, most comprehensive nursing schools, the Rutgers School of Nursing is dedicated to the pursuit of excellence in education, evidence-based research and health care delivery, and promotion of community health. The school is dedicated to meeting the educational needs of current and future students through innovative teaching and learning strategies in the undergraduate and graduate programs. Moreover, the school has distance education offerings that include online hybrid options. Students have the opportunity to enroll in a variety of baccalaureate and graduate programs.  

  

**Rutgers University School of Nursing is ranked among the nation’s top 15 in 2022-2024 US News and World Report, as No. 14 in** **Best Nursing Schools: Master’s** **and No. 6 in** **Best Nursing Schools: Doctor of Nursing Practice****.**  

**Rutgers School of Nursing is committed to fostering a diverse, equitable and inclusive community and seeks faculty and staff who embrace this commitment. Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution.**  

  

***\\*\\* To address the current and projected critical shortage of nurse faculty in the State of New Jersey by providing an incentive for persons to enter graduate nursing education programs by offering student loan redemption in exchange for full-time faculty employment at a school of nursing in the State of New Jersey for a five-year period following completion of the approved graduate degree program.***  

**https://he7606.hesaa.org/Pages/NursingFacultyLoanRedemptionProgram.aspx**

title: Genetic Counselor
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Genetic Counselor
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Medical (Clinical) - Genetics/Genomics/Genetic Counseling
  

**Department** RHG-RWJ OBGYN Clinic
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.  

  

Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Genetic Counselor for the OB/GYN Clinic at the Robert Wood Johnson Medical School.  

  

Provides clinical Pediatric and Perinatal genetic counseling services, under physician supervision when needed, for families and/or pregnancies at risk or suspected of having a genetic condition.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Constructs and analyzes a patient’s family history including genetic disease/birth defects and all relevant medical information in addition to addressing the reason for referral.
* Provides detailed assessment of patient’s pregnancy history including any exposures that may affect the fetus.
* Assists the MFM Physician or Clinical Geneticist as an integral component of the medical genetics team in providing genetic services for pediatric and adult patients.
* Assesses and interprets the risk for occurrence/recurrence of genetic conditions in the family and discusses such information with the MFM Physician or Clinical Geneticist and/or patient.
* Counsels patients on the nature of the condition(s) in question, including the contribution of heredity after discussion with the MFM Physician or Clinical Geneticist.
* Discusses with patients the options available for addressing genetic risks, including availability of carrier and prenatal diagnostic testing after case discussion with the MFM Physician or Clinical Geneticist.
* Counsels patients regarding the risks, benefits and limitations of genetic testing, as well as, its implications for reproductive choices.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift** Day
  

**Work Arrangement**
This position requires a fully on-site work arrangement.
  

**FLSA** Exempt
  

**Grade** 27S
  

**Position Salary**
  

**Annual Minimum Salary** 76438.00
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 91919.00
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 109279.00
  

**Standard Hours** 37.50
  

**Union Description** HPAE 5094
  

**Payroll Designation** PeopleSoft
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview**.  

  

**Seniority Unit**
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility** ABP
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Masters’ Degree in Human Genetics/Genetic Counseling or its equivalent required within six (6) months of hire.
* Documentation of training in genetic counseling techniques and experience in genetic counseling at a site accredited by the American Board of Medical Genetics (AMBG) or the American Board of Genetic Counseling (AMGC).


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Preference will be given to applicants who are board certified or eligible for board certification.
* Familiarity with the medical and research community in genetics as well as appropriate community resources pertaining to genetic family studies and new technologies in diagnosis and treatment of genetic disorders is highly desirable.


  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* Physical Demands: Standing, sitting, walking, talking or hearing. No special vision requirements. Ability to lift or exert up to 25 lbs.
* Work Environment: Office environment. Moderate Noise.


  

**Special Conditions**

title: Architectural Job Captain
company: JARMEL KIZEL ARCHITECTS AND ENGINEERS, INC.
description:
Jarmel Kizel Architects and Engineers, Inc. is seeking experienced Job Captains with strong technical skills in Revit to join our growing team. Our firm specializes in new buildings, retail roll-outs, and commercial office interiors. With our projects list expanding daily, we are looking for two dedicated professionals with proven experience in developing construction documents using Revit.

**Position Overview:**

* **Title:** Job Captain
* **Location:** Livingston, NJ
* **Job Type:** Full-time
* **Salary:** $70,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year
* **Work Schedule:** Monday to Friday, in-person

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Coordinate transformation of initial rough product designs into working documents using AutoCAD and Revit 2020.
* Model in Revit based on preliminary concepts, sketches, engineering calculations, specifications, and other data.
* Collaborate with design professionals and project participants during the modeling and coordination processes.
* Create typical details and trade-specific families in Revit.
* Review drawings and designs to ensure adherence to established specifications and standards.
* Consult with employees and clients or consultants on the development of plans and specifications.
* Direct and lead the work of others on the project team.
* Coordinate and communicate with the entire project team including engineering, construction, building ownerships, and building officials.
* Assist the project manager with construction administration, including creating RFI & submittal responses.

**Required Experience and Skills:**

* Minimum 3-5 years of experience with Revit and AutoCAD.
* Strong technical skills.
* Ability to work well in a team environment, delegate to, and mentor junior designers.
* Ability to prioritize and manage tasks against deadlines.
* Ability to lead the process of complex architectural and interior detailing.
* Space planning and hand sketching abilities.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree from an accredited school of architecture.
* High level of organization and attention to detail.
* Multi-tasking ability and good judgment.
* Self-starter, motivated, takes initiative, and has a strong work ethic.
* Client service skills.
* Competent knowledge of building codes, energy code compliance, and ADA compliance.
* Knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within the profession.
* Architectural license is not required, but assistance will be provided in obtaining one.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive compensation and benefits including:
* Medical insurance for the employee and family with major contributions by Jarmel Kizel
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

**Application Information:** Please highlight your Revit and construction document experience when responding to this advertisement. All resumes should be sent to the INDEED site.

**Relocation Requirement:** Candidates must be willing to reliably commute or plan to relocate to Livingston, NJ 07039 before starting work.

Join Jarmel Kizel Architects and Engineers, Inc., and advance your career with a firm committed to your professional growth and development. Apply now!

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
Description:
**Job Purpose**


The Human Resources Business Partner contributes to company performance by providing tactical and strategic reporting to drive initiatives and strategies in support of the business objectives. Partners with leadership to align HR strategy to business strategy by means of supportive and informative data.

 **Duties and Responsibilities**

* Pull and manipulate reports from the HRIS system, Dayforce; taking a logical approach to analyze, format and summarize data
* Partner with operational leaders, applying business acumen, to produce meaningful data to be used by various leaders and divisions across the global enterprise
* Question the data; dig in to determine 'the why', investigate and analyzes trends, metrics and reports to develop solutions, programs and policies
* Conduct analysis on reports and data and use information to create summaries to present information to leadership; go to leadership with questions with the goal of understanding the varying factors of the business and how that may impact reporting.
* Pull standing and periodic reports and distribute to the business on weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual basis
* Processes documentation and prepares reports relating to employee activities (training, performance evaluations, employee changes, and terminations, compensation and more) through the cyclical cycle of HR
* Generate and prepare slides/presentations in Powerpoint for review with business leaders
* Research industry, functional and global trends in order to reshape corporate programs, policies and activities aimed at further engaging and retaining employees
* May be utilized to perform other Business Partner duties, such as providing day-to-day coaching to leadership on a variety of actions to include employee relations issues, policy interpretation and application; talent management and development; and organizational design consultation. Ensuring organizational compliance with federal, state and local employment laws and regulations, updating HRIS system and more
* Work to streamline process; identify areas of improvement across HR processes and work to become more efficient individually and as a team
* Use, protect and disclose patients’ protected health information (PHI) only in accordance with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) standards
* Partners with Payroll; HRIS; and Compensation and Benefits functions as needed to provide solutions for clients.
* All other duties assigned.


Requirements:
**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in human resources, psychology, or business-related field
* Seven (7) to Ten (10) years of HR experience with at least two (2) years of HR Business Partner experience
* Five (5) years experience manipulating data in Microsoft Excel; VLOOKUP, Pivot tables, charts & graphs
* Experience at a matrixed organization or global organization, preferred
* Healthcare industry experience a plus

**Working Conditions**

* Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to move around the work area; Sit; perform manual tasks; operate tools and other office equipment such as computer, computer peripherals and telephones; extend arms; kneel; talk and hear.
* Mental Demands: The employee must be able to follow directions, collaborate with others, and handle stress.
* Work Environment: The noise level in the work environment is usually minimal.

*Med-Metrix will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service, veteran status, other non-merit-based factors, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.*

description:

The City of Jersey City (“The City”) is seeking a Recreational Aide for the Division of Recreation in the Department of Recreation & Youth Development. This position, under supervision, assists in organization, development, and personal leadership in recreation activities of all types; does other related duties as required.

**Job Duties:**

* Responds quickly and appropriately to potentially hazardous situations and incidents; reports and documents all incidents and accidents
* Manage skaters, ensuring that rink rules are being followed and that rink conditions are safe
* Assists skaters that have fallen and in need of assistance
* Assists with skate rental operations
* Responds quickly and appropriately to potentially hazardous situations and incidents; reports and documents all incidents and accidents
* Monitors participants to ensure orderly conduct
* Communicate clearly and responsibly to all patrons and staff
* Assists in the planning, organization, promotion, and implementation of recreational programs and activities
* Notifies manager of all incidents and facility concerns

* Ensure that all recreational guidelines and procedures are always followed

title: HR Representative - Residents (Personnel Representative), HR Administration/Elmhurst
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals:**

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

**NYC Health + Hospitals** is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description:**

The HR Representative, under the direct supervision of the Onboarding Manager, supports the Human Resources (HR) efforts at NYC Health + Hospitals/Elmhurst with an emphasis on Employment and Background. The HR Representative participates in the implementation of personnel administration and employee relations programs, and is responsible for ensuring that all employees and nonemployees are on-boarded in a timely manner. Additionally, this position supports all hospital surveys and audits.

**General tasks and responsibilities will include:**

* Responsible for accurate and timely onboarding of new employees, including Residents.
* Coordinates new employee orientation sessions, both locally and system-wide, as appropriate.
* Work with Office of Legal Affairs to process Visa’s, including but not limited to, H1-B & J-1.
* Process all paperwork and act as a liaison as needed with Dean’s Office and Regulatory bodies.
* Process temporary staffing and conversion requests with Right-Sourcing by serving as a liaison.
* Oversees the promotion and transfer process by validating minimum qualifications are met.
* Responsible for tracking expiring employee licensure by running monthly reports and updating PeopleSoft HRIS with current information.
* Utilizes PeopleSoft to enter data, security clearances, and identifies and reconciles salary discrepancies, and maintains system of record integrity.
* Collaborates with colleagues in other functional areas of Human Resources to maintain continuity of services to all employees.
* Maintains metrics on various employment data, including approved vacancies, time to hire and time to fill.
* Participates in hospital-wide surveys and audits.
* Provides coverage/relief of front desk staff and fields all general HR inquiries to appropriate individuals.
* Performs all other related duties as assigned by the HR management team.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

1. Associate’s Degree from an accredited college or university in Human Resources Management, Public Relations, Healthcare Administration, or a related discipline; or  
2. High School Diploma or its educational equivalent and two (2) years of relevant experience in human resources, administration, labor relations, employee relations, learning and development, talent acquisition, customer service (providing information and resolving customer concerns), or a related administrative support function.

**Department Preferences**

* PHR or SHRM-CP
* Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant filed from an accredited college or university
* Previous HR experience in a hospital or healthcare setting
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
* Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality
* Ability to be flexible with working schedule, including evening hours when needed
* 1-2 years of HR experience

**Knowledgeable in:**

* Recruitment & Onboarding
* Background Investigation
* New Employee Orientation
* Rewards & Recognition
* Compliance/Licensure
* Survey Preparation

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: R&D TSA Spring Co-op
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



The Wound Closure & Healing and Biosurgery R&D Organization in Raritan, NJ, is recruiting for R&D Co-ops and interns. Wound Closure & Healing and Biosurgery (WCHB) are a part of the Johnson & Johnson MedTech Surgery organization.



The MedTech Organization, based in Raritan, New Jersey, was founded more than 80 years ago as a pioneer in suture development and manufacturing, helping to transform the safety and effectiveness of open surgery. The MedTech Organization offers a broad range of products, platforms and technologies including— sutures, hemostasis products, surgical staplers, trocars, energy devices and synthetic mesh devices—that are used in a wide variety of minimally-invasive and open surgical procedures. Specialties include support for treatment of colorectal and thoracic conditions, women's health conditions, hernias, oncology, and obesity.



Positions are available in many subgroups of R&D and may include some or all of the following responsibilities:


* Hands-on laboratory work in a chemistry or engineering lab
* Performing studies and developing test methods and fixtures
* Good documentation practices, including writing test protocols, generating final reports, and documenting meeting minutes
* Crafting and evaluating prototypes
* Attending and participating in voice-of-customer (VOC) labs
* Collaborating with engineers and outside suppliers to support project related activities


If you are passionate about these opportunities, please apply below.

  

**Qualifications**
------------------


* Be enrolled (not necessarily taking classes) in an accredited college/university during the Co-op session.
* Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or a related technical field.
* Only students who have completed their freshman year or above will be considered.
* For co-ops, availability to work full-time (40 hours/week) during the Co-op session.
* A minimum GPA of 3.0 is strongly preferred.
* Demonstrated leadership and/or participation in campus programs and/or community service activities is desired.
* A high level of organization and the ability to handle multiple tasks.
* Be comfortable working independently, as well as on a team.
* Proficient in lab-based chemistry activities.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, and Power Point, and have strong oral and written communication skills.
* Legal authorization to work in the United States and not require future sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H1-B status) now or in the future.
* Ability to provide their own transportation to this work location.


Technical Degrees:



The anticipated base pay for this position is Sophomore $25.00/hr, Junior $26.00/hr, Senior $28.00/hr, Master’s degree $33/hr.



Business Degrees:



The anticipated base pay for this position is Sophomore $22.00/hr, Junior $23.00/hr, Senior $24.00/hr, Master’s degree $30.00/hr.



For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to:


* https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits.


This job posting is anticipated to close on 10/08/2024. The Company may however extend this time-period, in which case the posting will remain available on https://www.careers.jnj.com to accept additional applications.



Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

**An elite, high-net-worth-focused matrimonial firm in midtown Manhattan seeks to hire a junior/midlevel associate with strong writing skills and who ideally has matrimonial experience. The role would involve a mix of litigation and non-litigation, including negotiation/settlement, working on prenuptial agreements, and significant client contact. The firm seeks an associate who will be a strong draftsperson and have financial savvy. Attorneys are expected to work from the office at least three days per week, and they offer a casual environment. The base salary would likely be about $130,000, and the bonus can be about $25,000-$30,000, depending on the individual’s and firm’s performance; compensation goes up nicely from there as long as performance is strong. They offer attorneys 20% of collections on matters they originate, and the firm expects attorneys to bill about 1600 hours per year (the office is empty at 6 p.m., and weekends and late nights are not expected except if necessary). They pay 100% of an attorney’s health insurance premiums and offer a liberal vacation policy.**

title: Auditor
description:
The Auditor is responsible for the financial analysis and investigative work associated with bankruptcy cases under applicable law, to support the litigation and civil enforcement efforts of the USTP. The Auditor performs work that is similar in scope and complexity to that performed by a public accounting firm.

The typical duties of an Auditor include:

* Apply professional accounting knowledge and understanding of general business operations to complex chapter 7 and 11 bankruptcy cases;
* Work closely with Trial Attorneys to analyze bankruptcy cases and supporting financial documentation to determine adequacy and accuracy, sometimes for testimony at trial;
* Perform exams, audits, reviews, and analysis of bankruptcy cases administered by standing and panel trustees. Determine trustees’ adequacy, accuracy, and compliance with accounting principles and practices;
* Provide a variety of accounting and auditing services associated with chapter 7 and 11 matters;
* Work closely with Trial Attorneys on large chapter 11 cases to determine the adequacy of information provided by debtors at the beginning of the case and during its pendency; and,
* Ensure the debtor's compliance with required forms and documents.

To learn more about the qualifications and application process, please select the Apply link.

title: Adult Nurse Practitioner (ANP)
description:
Job Description:

Noir Well Mobile Adult Health is seeking a skilled and compassionate, community and quality care focused Adult-Geriatric Nurse Practitioner (ANP/AGNP) to join our growing practice in Brooklyn, NY. As an integral member of our team, you will provide high-quality primary care services, focusing on prevention, wellness, and the management of chronic conditions for adult patients in the community.

Key Responsibilities:

- Conduct thorough patient assessments, reviewing medical history and performing accurate diagnoses for adult patients.

- Develop personalized treatment plans that include medical care, preventative measures, and wellness strategies.

- Collaborate with primary care physicians and other healthcare professionals to ensure coordinated and integrated patient care.

- Prescribe medications, order and interpret diagnostic tests, and provide appropriate treatments based on findings.

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date electronic medical records (EMR) to ensure thorough patient documentation.

- Provide patient education and counseling on health promotion, disease prevention, and management of chronic conditions.

- Uphold ethical and professional standards in all interactions and communications with patients and colleagues.

- Engage in community outreach events to promote wellness and preventive care within underserved populations.

- Maintain accurate and detailed patient records, adhering to healthcare regulations and clinic policies.

- Participate in quality improvement initiatives and ongoing education to stay updated on best practices.

Qualifications:

- Current and valid Nurse Practitioner license in New York.

- Certification as an Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner (ANP).

- Board Certification through ANCC or AANP.

- At least 2 years of full-time experience in primary care, with strong clinical skills in managing chronic conditions and preventive care.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with a diverse patient population.

- Experience with electronic health records (EHR) systems.

- Experience treating HIV/AIDS and other infectious diseases is a plus

- Commitment to ongoing professional development and staying current with best practices in primary care.

About Noir Well Mobile Adult Health:

We are committed to providing equal, high-quality care for all individuals, regardless of race, creed, color, gender identity, or any other characteristic. Our mission is to eliminate disparities in healthcare and ensure everyone receives the care they deserve.

title: Registered Nurse - OR
description:
Registered Nurse Job Description

Position Description:

The Registered Nurse will have the expertise to plan and oversee the smooth functioning of all aspects of patient care from pre-procedure through post-procedure phase. The registered nurse will have the ability to function in a variety of settings as assigned, based on the needs of the center. Provides nursing care within national and state standards of practice and the policies of the Center. Actively participates in Performance Improvement activities. Maintains professional conduct and appearance. Upholds the Mission of the Center is flexible, reliable, patient-oriented and self-motivated.

Reports To:

Director of Nursing

Qualifications:

* Current New Jersey Registered Nurse License.
* Minimum 3 years related experience) PRE-OP, SDS, PACU, OR, Endo, Critical Care) BCLS, ACLS certification.
* Certification in IV therapy and telemetry preferred.
* Computer skills preferred.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Responsibilities:

* Responsible for the delivery and documentation of all phases of care, (pre, intra and post­ procedure).
* Performs patient assessments and meets their educational needs throughout all phases of care.
* Demonstrates knowledge of patients' developmental needs across the lifespan from 6 months to geriatric.
* Provides quality patient care as outlined in professional standards of care and the center's policies and procedures.
* Maintains a safe environment by strict adherence to established safety principles and practice, including, but not limited to universal precautions, hazardous waste management, positioning, and aseptic technique.
* Reviews and monitors environmental surveillance as assigned (i.e.: temperature and humidity, sterilization logs, high level disinfectants, etc.).
* Ensures all supplies and equipment are available and functioning in the assigned area.
* Leads team in room turnover and environmental procedures following established protocols for cleaning of work areas and equipment in established time frames to ensure quick and efficient utilization of areas.
* Assists with in-service and training and provides ongoing review of related topics to personnel at all levels.
* Actively participates and attends staff in-services and meetings.
* Maintains current knowledge of technical developments and use of instrumentation and equipment.
* Ability to take the charge role as assigned by the Director of Nursing.
* Assists in product evaluation and recommends cost effectiveness of products.
* Assists in development of policies and procedures.
* Ability to interact and communicate effectively, both verbally and written, with a variety of people, including, but not limited to, physicians, patients and families, physician's office staff, referring facilities and other staff members.
* Ability to work well in a team and switch roles quickly to accommodate the needs of the center.
